As long as you put the water in the back (as instructed), it totally works. I love how they include the squeegee and have a slot for it as well. 5 star rating for me.<br /><br />Read the instructions: I mounted this on tile, which is not completely flat, and if you use ALL the glue (as instructed), and wait 24 hours (as instructed), you will be rather pleased.

  13. Ok so there are some pros and cons to buying this product and you will have to decide for yourself.<br /><br />I will start by saying that the item was shipped quickly and was received in perfect condition. But there are a few things to mention.<br />Some pros first:<br />The mirror is large and it tilts so different people with different heights can use it. The shelf is neat for your razor.<br /><br />Here are some cons I found:<br />the mirror DOES fog right up when the water is hot. I have mine mounted opposite the shower head on the wall, the water does not hit it. Now I didn't really expect it not to fog, I haven't found one ever that never fogs so I was prepared. I found that if you use body wash (or any soap really) and a shower sponge you can use the soap to create a steam barrier and it stays fog less long enough for a complete shave so I'm ok with that. And the squeegee is a nice thought but as soon as you use it, the mirror becomes dry and fogs right up. I mounted mine on clean dry tile and 2 days after I mounted I was awoken in the middle of the night when it fell off the wall and rolled around the tub. Now even though it fell it did not break, it's pretty tough. So all I did was remount it using stronger tape and it's been 3 weeks and still holding.<br /><br />So I'll just say I gave it 3 stars because I pretty much got what I expected. Wasn't disappointed or overly excited.<br />It's a large, tough mirror and if your ok with passing a little soap over it then you should be happy.

  15. Over the years I have tried what I thought was about every 'fogless' mirror available and had resigned myself to shaving in the shower with the perpetual struggle of doing my best with products that didn't ready deliver. This mirror is amazing! My experience with mirrors that were mounted with suction cups was that they would not adhere properly to anything but the smoothest surfaces, thus ceramic tile with even a little texture prevented any type of secure mounting. This mirror mounts easily and securely without drilling; and it stays fog-free and delivers a crystal clear image. I have been so impressed with its performance that I purchased an additional one for my vacation home. It may not be the best looking shower mirror out there, but it is unequivocally one of the best you can buy.

  29. I am sad to have only found out about this now, I'm almost 30 years old and I'm one of those early bloomers if I may call it that. Started shaving at around 15 years old. So I've been shaving for almost 15 year by now, and I've hated every single shower mirror solution ever suggested to me.<br /><br />It wasn't until I ran across this mirror that I simply had to try it for myself to believe it. Boy was I in for a treat. I set the base up, fill the silicone gaps and peel the adhesive. 24 hours later, I have a fogless mirror in my tub.<br /><br />So what's so awesome about this mirror? Well, it doesn't fog.. I've tried all I can from blowing air at it, to cranking up the water to steaming heat, the mirror beads up a little, but there is NO FOG.<br /><br />How you might say? Well the genius is in the reservoir that houses the water that you fill prior to taking your shower. When that reservoir is filled to the top with warm/moderately hot water, it becomes in direct contact with the back-side of the mirror. This insures that the mirror is the same temperature or close to that of the steamy water vapor that dominates the air inside and around the bath tub, when that happens, water does not condensate on the cold surface of the mirror, instead, it simply passes by or beeds up into big distinctive water drops.<br /><br />Whether you care about the sciency part of this or not, if you want to shave in your shower, without having to wipe it every second, GET THIS PRODUCT. No I am not paid by the people that made this, I simply enjoy it that much that I took that much time to write about it.<br /><br />Good products deserve good feedback.<br /><br />A few tips for those unsure about placement/adhesion:<br /><br />- Make sure you follow the instructions, that is to put the silcone tube, in its ENTIRETY over the marked gaps, and allow for 24 hours of adhesion before using/running the shower.<br />- Make sure you pour tolerably hot/warm water into the reservoir before you shower or else the product WILL NOT WORK. The key part of this whole process is the warm water, its what makes it work.<br />- Drain the reservoir when you're done, and if you can, put it upside down so it dries nicely. Dark wet areas when left can be home to algae and other nasty stuff. Be clean and be proactive about it.<br /><br />That is all, hope you find this useful.or else the product WILL NOT WORK. The key part of this whole process is the warm water, its what makes it work.<br />- Drain the reservoir when you're done, and if you can, put it upside down so it dries nicely. Dark wet areas when left can be home to algae and other nasty stuff. Be clean and be proactive about it.<br /><br />That is all, hope you find this useful.

  54. Finally a fogless mirror that actually remains clear in the shower and sticks to the wall! I like that I can brush my teeth, take off my makeup, and my husband can also shave in the shower too. The mirror came with 2 pieces of double stick tape and a tube of silicone adhesive. The adhesive is strong and the mirror will stay secure. It comes with a convenient little tray that you can put a shaver, tweezer, sponge, or toothbrush. It also comes with a little squeegee just in case your mirror gets water or smudges on it. The mirror is also adjustable. Mostly importantly it will always remain fogless, because it contains a reservoir that you fill with hot water, the water neutralizes the mirror and air temperature to eliminate fogging. The mirror conveniently detaches so reservoir is easy to fill. Overall, this is definitely the best Fogless Mirror I have seen and use so far and I really do recommend it. So far it is working great for me and my husband and with features like an adjustable frame, shatter proof, rust proof, easily attaches to tile, and a shelf, the mirror just keeps getting better!

  57. While this product is two to 2-3 times the price of your average shower mirror, it's easily 5-6 times the product. Admittedly, I was quite skeptical when I ordered it, but I promise you that it's truly well designed and fog-free, and the adhesive/silicon mount is infinitely more solid than cheaper suction-cup models.<br /><br />I've been shaving my face for about 20 years and my head for around 10, and I've owned countless shower mirrors in that time. This model is definitely the best, by leaps and bounds. Fog free chemicals only work briefly, if they work at all, but the hot-water reservoir in the back of this mirror works the hundredth time just as well as it did the first.<br /><br />If, like me, you are tired of the cheap mirrors that lose their fog-free coating after a week or two and come crashing down in the middle of the night when the suction cup gives out, then buy this mirror. You won't be sorry.

  66. Finally a shower mirror that actually works! I've owned a bunch of shower mirrors over the years and even though they all claimed to never fog up, they all did. I was always having to splash water on them every 30 seconds to clear the fog. However, this mirror uses the simple premise that if the temperature of the mirror is the same as the air around it, it won't fog up. So by filling the back of mirror with hot shower water, the mirror doesn't fog. Simple, yet genius! I highly recommend this product.
  67. This product lived up to all of the expectations. So far, it has held fast to the wall, through some pretty steamy showers. If the instructions are followed, it really does remain fog free. I would highly recommend this product.

  76. I bought this mirror based on all the positive reviews I saw on Amazon, and I wasn't let down.   77. It's hard to shave in the shower - can't see what you're doing, even though you've probably done it for years. My hubby uses the sink and always leaves me a mess. A few strips of tape and their silocone that applies easily (just peels right off and leaves no mess) will hang the bracket. Then your mirror just slides on right on.   83. I've been using this mirror for a few months now and it really works. I had an older version without the part that holds the hot water and despite claims there was no way to keep that clear.<br /><br />This product however, gives you a clear mirror every time. I read some earlier reviews complaining about emptying and filling the water reservoir but I have to say it could not be easier. When I get in, I empty the water from before, put the mirror back on the holder ( the fact that somebody mentioned they had difficulty with this is beyond me, it slots straight in. It's about as difficult as putting the top on your pen!). I then have a plastic cup which I fill from the shower pour it in and that's it, clear mirror.
  84. Fogless Shower Mirror by ToiletTree<br /><br />The good:<br />1. Water reservoir method is truly the way to keep a mirror fog-free (the coated mirrors or the drops to coat them yourself - don't work and eventually get so hazy you can't see anything)<br />2. The squeegee - nice. Better than bringing your towel in<br />3. The small shelf below the mirror - nice - for a razor or toothbrush.<br />4. Very strong mounting with silicone gel/glue (instead of suction cups which can occasionally slide loose)<br /><br />The bad:<br />1. The mirror has distortion. If you divide it into thirds, the outer two thirds are essentially un-usable - there is even a bit of distortion at top and bottom. I find the fun-house affect on the outer edges very distracting.<br />2. The slot to put the mirror back into the holder is difficult to line up. You take the mirror out to fill it with the hot water, and putting it back in requires craning your head to see behind the mirror to align it so it slides in, if you just try to do it \\"blind\\" you'll often get only half in and end up sloshing some water around etc.<br />3. No drain hole.<br /><br />The whole reason I got this mirror is that I was using the \\"Ace Fogless Shower Mirror\\" (also uses a water reservoir) - which is not as wide, and I thought it would be great to have the same mirror but wider, and with nice shelf. However, because of the distortion, you end up getting about the same \\"usable\\" area in both mirrors - about 4-5\\". But the [[ASIN:B0019CU2GU Ace Fogless Shower Mirror]] just ends at 5\\" - no extra fun-house mirror margins [uselessly] extending the width.<br /><br />Another thing with the ToiletTree mirror is the lack of drain hole. With the Ace mirror, because it drains in about 20 minutes, you have the option of either taking the mirror out and filling it directly from the shower head and replacing it in the holder (which is designed so you can EASILY and quickly place it in the holder \\"blind\\", no missing), OR, you can leave it in place and use a cup to pour in some hot water. You can't do that with the ToiletTree mirror because it stays filled up with the old (now cold) water. So you are forced to remove the ToiletTree mirror, fill it up at the faucet, and carefully try to slide it back in place. If I didn't already have the super-easy experience of the Ace Mirror's design I wouldn't complain, but having gotten used to the easier one (and without any distortion), for way less money ($15 at Target), I can't see any reason why I would recommend this one, and I plan on putting my old Ace mirror back up. Yes Ace uses suction cups which can come loose, and yes the razor holder is not made to fit many razor and toothbrush widths so it ends up going un-used. But those are minor issues compared to the fact that it is distortion free and MUCH easier to re-fill with water each time you shower.can't do that with the ToiletTree mirror because it stays filled up with the old (now cold) water. So you are forced to remove the ToiletTree mirror, fill it up at the faucet, and carefully try to slide it back in place. If I didn't already have the super-easy experience of the Ace Mirror's design I wouldn't complain, but having gotten used to the easier one (and without any distortion), for way less money ($15 at Target), I can't see any reason why I would recommend this one, and I plan on putting my old Ace mirror back up. Yes Ace uses suction cups which can come loose, and yes the razor holder is not made to fit many razor and toothbrush widths so it ends up going un-used. But those are minor issues compared to the fact that it is distortion free and MUCH easier to re-fill with water each time you shower.

  91. It works. Installation was easy, I simply found a spot in my shower that looked like it would provide the best light for shaving and followed the directions from the insert. After about 11 hours (I didn't wait the entire 12 hours, or whatever it suggests) I filled the reservoir with hot water from the shower and began shaving. It's as simple as that, really.<br /><br />The mirror DOES NOT fog providing the water in the reservoir stays warm. I've spent up to 15 minutes in the shower without it fogging, any longer than that and you might have to dump out the lukewarm water and refill it. I really, really don't understand these people who are having a difficult time filling/refilling it with warm water. When I begin my shower I dump out the cold water from my last shower, place the mirror under the facet and fill it with warm water, and step into the shower. It's not rocket science. Now let's suppose you take an unusually long shower and the mirror begins to fog, you have two choices: 1.) panic and write a negative review about how terribly inconvenient it is when the mirror fogs, or 2.) accept the fact that this product wasn't designed by aliens with super powers, spend 4-7 seconds refilling it with warm water, and continue shaving.<br /><br />Now, onto the negatives...<br /><br />The mirror spots up pretty easily. I've had this very same problem with shaving mirrors before. It doesn't spot up to the point that I can't use it, but it's still a bit annoying. Also, the squeegee doesn't work well. It just ends up smearing the water droplets on the mirror and making it worse. I usually end up removing the mirror from the wall, running it under water and \\"cleaning\\" the spots with my finger, and replacing it. This isn't something I have to deal with EVERY shower, but often enough to bring it up.<br /><br />Anyways, it's worth $20-something dollars.<br /><br />***Edit on 2/9/14:***<br /><br />After about 2.5 years the gear that allows you to adjust the mirror up and down wore out. It'd still lock into place, but not when the water reservoir was full. This little mirror's been a solid performer though, so much so that I bought another one for my new house.

I think to earn a five, the manufacturers could add a slight tilt/valve that allows you to simply open it up to empty out after each shower.   126. I have been using a mirror to shave in the shower for about 20 years. I have bought all types and prices but even though they all start by working reasonably well, after a while they all lose their protective coating and begin to fail (or worse, parts of them begin to rust). The ToiletTree mirror has a completely different approach and it works very well. Granted, it requires some involvement on the part of the user, as the reservoir behind the reflective surface needs to be filled with hot water and emptied after using it, but it is a matter of a couple of minutes, nothing major. The reason I give it 4 stars is that I think that the emptying of the reservoir could be made easier by adding a drain at the bottom with a rubber stopper, making it easier to empty (after all, it is in the shower, the water is going nowhere but down the drain). So instead of having to remove the mirror and dumping the water, it could be left to drain, reducing further the user daily involvement. That said, the mirror works great regardless.

  146. The Fogless Shower Mirror by ToiletTree is the Best Fogless Mirror on the Market. I have been waiting to write this review since I bought it July 5, 2010 on Amazon.com, but to give my review more credence I waited the recommended 30 days. First, this fogless mirror works perfectly. I have yet to see any fog develop on the mirror what so ever. It is lightweight plastic or similar. The mirror appears to be glass, but it is a high quality reflection without distortion (just a little). It is perfect for any task that you might perform in or out of the shower, but I use it to shave. If you have never shaved in the shower, I urge you to buy this mirror and start shaving in the shower for a closer and more comfortable shaving experience. It uses adhesives to attach to a shower wall. Follow the instructions carefully to mount the mirror mount to the shower wall. Once the mirror is mounted it is permanent, but you can adjust the viewing angle up or down. You must fill the reservoir with warm or hot water in order for the mirror to remain fogless. That is easy to do. Why I like this type of fogless mirror is the placement of the mirror in relationship to the shower stream. Other mirrors that attach to the shower/water pipe have you standing in and facing the shower stream. That type of mirror allows the water to splash in your face and eyes. The ToiletTree Fogless Shower Mirror allows you to mount the mirror anywhere in the shower that you please so pick your spot carefully as it is permanently mounted.<br /><br />Update Dec 15, 2010<br />It's getting close to Christmas; this will make a great gift.   161. I have owned this mirror for a few months now, and everything has been great so far. I had owned several \\"fogless\\" mirrors in the past and they all failed, whether it was losing the anti-fog ability, or falling off the shower wall. This product has been firmly attached to the wall since the day I bought it and as has never fogged up in the shower (as long as you use it properly). The only issue I had with the product was with the silicon adhesive tube that comes with it. You use the gel to attach the mirror to the shower wall. The tube I received had hardened, which made it impossible to squeeze out the gel properly. Yes, I punctured the tip before squeezing, but it would not work. I ended up squeezing so hard that the tube ruptured in the middle so I ended up applying the gel with my finger. Other than that, the product is great. I did not deduct any stars from my review because of this since this issue has nothing to do with the functioning of the mirror.
  162. As advertised, when it's filled with warm water the mirror doesn't fog up in the shower, so the anti-fog technology does indeed work. On the other hand, although the mirror is good enough for shaving, the image is seriously distorted. More important, at least for me, it's a real pain having to remount the mirror precisely on its inconvenient bracket twice during a single shower -- once after filling the tank and again after emptying the tank. Perhaps I'm just not coordinated, since no one else seems to have a similar complaint. But I never find it easy to replace the mirror on its bracket. This is a clever product, but I hope that someday, someone will come up with an easier way to keep a mirror from fogging up in the shower without any hassle, so that users can just set it up once and then forget it forever.
  163. With such a large selection of (so-called) fogless mirrors, it can be a bit tough to research what to look for exactly. Hopefully I can save you some time and offer some insight. This particular mirror features the best design and all the best features. You can tell they put some real thought into it. Here's a few reasons why: 1. It uses hot water behind the mirror, which does a fantastic (arguably the best) job of keeping a mirror fogless. The mirror slides easily in and out of a relatively large U-shaped bracket. It just takes a second or two to fill the reservoir on the back with hot tub/shower water, and you're set - it will not fog up! No kidding, from my own experience. 2. No suction cups, no crashing mirror. The mount uses relatively strong, semi-permanent adhesives; two square pieces of double sided tape (nearly identical to the mounting squares you see in hardware stores) and a generously sized tube of silicone. Both the silicone and tape have specifically marked places for use on the mounting bracket. Note, that while these are nice and waterproof, and much more reliable then suction cups, neither is permanent-permanent. Silicone is not super glue; it can be removed, along with the tape, without much fuss at a later time if desired. 3. The design is nice, clean, simple, and not too small. Form follows function. The reservoir widens nicely on top to make filling it easier. The shelf below is perfect for your razor, without any needless holding mechanisms. Other shower mirrors are rather small, this one is just the right size (imo) at 6.5in x 8.5in. 4. There's a nice, full-length rubber-y squeegee for wiping down the mirror. Any mirror will acquire drops from the spray while you shower. This squeegee cleans them off much better and more thoroughly then your own hands do. Take a look at the fourth and fifth pictures to get a good idea. The black handle slides horizontally into a compartment under the front shelf; the actual white squeegee parthangs down, which makes grabbing it and pulling it out easy. 5. Although irrelevant, even the way it was boxed/packaged was nicely done. In summation, I rarely give items full stars with no criticism of any kind; even five-star items generally have some minor negative points. This is one of those rare items I simply cannot find fault with. I honestly can't think of any way it could be improved. And although it can cost more then some other shower mirrors, these mirrors are all relatively inexpensive, anyway, so I don't see why that matters. Getting something this fantastic is well worth a few extra bucks.

You have to dump out the water and refill for the next shower if that wasn't obvious. The mirror can also be tilted up and down in set detentes to accommodate people of different heights. Assuming you put the mirror in a good place in the shower, you will not be disappointed by this product.

  186. I love this shower mirror. It works really well, but you must know that you need to fill the reservoir with warm/hot water. At first I assumed (idiotically, maybe) that you just filled it up once and it would work, but the water will cool off and it will not work well. I pour out the reservoir and refill it when I first get in the shower and the water gets warm. (Pour it close to the drain so you won't get cold water splashing on you- yowsah!) Then I shower with a cooler water. It only takes one quick swipe with the squeegie to clear any water off the surface. By the time I'm ready to shave it's still crystal clear. The shelf is handy, too. The thing seems to be mounted quite securely... so far no inkling that it will fall off the shower wall.   201. We just had our tub re-glazed. I was worried about our existing suction cup mirror falling and scratching the tub. The old mirror also fogged up all of the time and we had to smear soap on it when we wanted to use it. I purchased this new mirror mainly because it is not supposed to fall. The other features were interesting but I didn't really appreciate them until I started using it. I put the bracket up according to the instructions - not difficult at all. The bracket and the mirror are rock solid so I am not worried about them falling. I like that this mirror is a little bit larger, and can be angled up or down a few degrees as needed. You fill a space behind the mirror with water and that is supposed to keep it from fogging up. Seems to work as described. There is also a shelf that I have found to be very convenient. I take my glasses into the shower so I can clean them every day, and the shelf is a good place for them. The mirror and bracket/shelf stick out from the wall a few inches (more than my suction cup mirror). I thought this would be a problem but so far, so good. Keep this in mind when you put the mirror up in your own shower.

  210. We've all experienced products that claim to be one thing but don't turn out as expected. The ToiletTree Fogless Shower Mirror was not one of them.<br /><br />Installation steps were easy to follow with the adhesive and the double stick tape. Wait 24 hours for the adhesive to dry and you're ready to go.<br /><br />Just as you start showering, make sure you fill the reservoir cup with hot water to prevent the fogging. The fog prevention is done by raising the temp of the mirror with the temp of the air (like when you roll down your car windows to defog your windshield). It's nice that it isn't using a coating or any chemicals because those can peel or fade away.<br /><br />The squeegee works perfectly to help clear off the drops of water and stores conveniently in the little shelf so you don't have to find it among your shampoo bottles.<br /><br />Overall, the ToiletTree Fogless Shower Mirror gives you exactly what it should - a mirror that doesn't fog up in the shower.

  215. I'm sure you've gone through at least one of the cheap worthless mirrors that fog up no matter what you do to prevent it. Well the best new concept is placing hot water behind the mirror to stop condensation and is the only designed on the market now I've found to effectively work. So after lengthy research of product reviews for the available shower mirrors, I was able to narrow my search down to the Ace shower mirror ($15) and the ToiletTree shower mirror ($30). Both use the same water reservoir design. Here's how Ace Shower Mirror compares: Pros of Ace Shower Mirror: -doesn't fog -half the price of Toilet Tree's product -can be found at Target as well as Amazon MAJOR CON of Ace Shower Mirror: -Many customers complain about it falling off the wall because of the cheap suction cup design Well, ToiletTree solved this major flaw and provides two square adhesives and a tube of super-special glue to place around the back of the mirror holder. This was the selling point for me, but I was concerned about not being able to move the mirror to my new apartment in a month. So I emailed their customer service asking if I could find this similar adhesive in a local store. I got a prompt response from Kelly the service rep and she let me know that it's not a problem and she can mail me new adhesives free of charge. Fast forward a few days-I received a package in the mail with what she promised-and a hand-written card! I can't comment on how easy it is to remove yet, but the website states that it does not ruin surfaces. OVERALL: an excellent product that does what it says with excellent customer service to back it up. Such an easy formula for a successful product but so many companies fail to do these two things. Some things I would look forward to seeing in an improved version, but still minor, a slightly larger sized mirror and some sort of waterproof light as proper lighting makes a huge difference if there's not much light in your shower. End of rant - now stop reading and go get one!!

  224. I'm going to increase the number of 5-star reviews by one.<br /><br />I feel like it's a rare experience for me to order something where it installation is well-documented and easy, and it works as advertised.<br /><br />Most products suction cups, which I consider something to avoid.<br /><br />1) They usually won't work on textured tiles (like ours) due to uneven surface.<br />2) They tend to pop-off periodically and eventually they just fail completely<br /><br />This product uses a silicone adhesive. (There are sticky tabs, but they are only to hold it in place while the adhesive cures.)<br /><br />The mirror simply does NOT fog and the reason is because it uses a very simple reliable method: you fill a tub behind the mirror with heated water from the shower and thus, there is no mismatch in temperature between the mirror and the humid air, which is what causes fog.<br /><br />The product comes with a squeegee to wipe drops off the mirror and to keep it clean (instructions warn against using household cleaners) and my experience has been that the mirror stays clean so long as you wipe it down each time and thus avoid dried water droplets.<br /><br />The mirror also pivots so you can mount it high and aim it down, or mount it low and aim it up, and of course, that accommodates people of different height.<br /><br />I find that I can cut 10 minutes out of my VERY busy morning routine just by shaving in the shower. I also get a better shave because my beard has been softened by the warm water, and of course rinsing the lather off your face is more convenient in a shower than a sink. Of course, you use FAR more hot water if you do it in a shower, but I just turn the water off while I shave.<br /><br />I love this thing. I suspect it makes a great gift.

The science behind this product is simple...if you keep the mirror at a temperature close to the air inside the shower it won't fog up. You do have to use the included glue to attach the mirror to our shower wall, but I was happy to do so for a product that works this well.   246. Toilet Tree has a winner in this fog-less mirror made for the shower-although presumably it could used about a basin which would be filled with hot water. The mirror, which is filled with warm to hot water, slides easily into an easy to use U shaped mounting and the squeegee( yes, a real squeegee to clean the mirror from water) slides into a thoughtfully placed container in the front of the piece. The mirror adjusts up and down so it's not just for one person (I'm six five and people as short as 5' 8\\" say it rotates down to make it easy for them to effectively use.) Unlike similar mirrors, there's no need to do plumbing to keep it clear, just the one fill up does the trick and that lasts for a long time. The water container behind the non-breakable mirror is sufficiently insulated so that the heat doesn't quickly diminish. I shave both my head and my face and using this product not only is of a great help to me but, I believe, assists in getting a better shave.

The mirror was delivered quickly; it was simple to install and it's worked like a charm. Previously, I've tried several suction cup devices, but because my shower tile has a very subtle texture to it, the cups did not hold, plus the mirrors always fogged up. My shower tile looks smooth and flat, but there is enough texture to it to prevent a long-lasting hold. The silicone adhesive provided with this product is very strong and I am confident that the mirror and mount will hold fast for many years. One of the reviewers discovered that there is no need to empty the reservoir every day. He simply poured warm shower water into the previously filled reservoir. The newly-added warm water displaces the left-over cold water and the mirror remains fog free. I tried it and it works very nicely. This way I do not have to physically remove the mirror from its mount and empty it. How lazy is that? Great product and well worth the price!

  262. I purchased this because my cheap Walmart fogless mirror wasn't fogless and since I couldn't see anything in it while shaving I don't think it counted as a mirror anymore. I can stand in the middle of the shower and still see myself perfectly which is really helpful since I'm mildly far-sighted. Very pleased with this product. *Update: Need to upgrade this review from 5 stars to 6 thanks to superior customer service I was having some issues with hard water in my new apartment and it was causing some crusting on my mirror. I decided to try emailing the company. Here is what I wrote: My only problem is that I moved to an apartment with extremely hard water. Apparently the town is actually known for its hard water. Even rinsing the mirror after each use I'm still noticing a lot of sediment buildup. If i gently scrap it off with a fingernail I can clean it somewhat for a few weeks but it keeps coming back. Is there anything I can use to clean the surface that will dissolve some of the minerals but not destroy the coating on the mirror? Here is the response I got 10 MINUTES LATER!: We have had some customers complain about the issue of hard water and have come up with some solutions. For initially cleaning the water spotting off, we recommend taking white vinegar and letting it sit on the mirror surface for a few minutes. Once you wipe the vinegar away, you should have a clear mirror. Then, to avoid future build up, we recommend using either car or boat wax and applying a thin layer of it to the mirror surface which helps repel the water spots from occurring. I hope these tips are able to help you. If by any chance, your mirror still does not become clear, please let me know and I will be happy to send you out a replacement mirror. Please let me know if you have any other questions! I am honestly stunned by how fast and helpful the response was. Great customer service for a product I was already happy with.

  267. I now have the mirror installed, and it works beautifully. I like it so much I'm getting one for my dad for this Father's Day.<br /><br />It's a great design: after years of trying different mirrors that supposedly came with some anti-fog coating, here's something that solves the problem once and for all. I see what others are saying about a bit of distortion, and yes, there is some slight distortion, but it's far better than any other shaving mirror I've encountered and doesn't bother me in the least.<br /><br />Even better, they have great customer service. I happened to be unlucky and get a box that didn't come with silicone sealant. When I called the next morning, a real person who spoke English picked up on pretty much the first ring, very competently understood what my problem was and what was needed to fix it. In a few days, I received a new tube of silicone sealant in my mailbox!<br /><br />One note about where to affix the mirror: put it in the back of the shower *away* from the showerhead. If you put it near the front, you'll get sprayed in the face every time you try to use the mirror. It's possible to move the mirror after it's been affixed, but a lot of work involving a good deal of scraping, since that silicone sealant is really quite effective.<br /><br />[Update 21 Jan 2014] After a few years, it actually fell after the sealant failed! I didn't hesitate before buying a brand new version of the exact same thing. This one came with the sealant, and is working perfectly. [/End Update]
  268.   269. This is an excellent shower mirror and well worth the money. My husband has been in search of a fogless shower mirror that acutally works and this one is right on the money. It is worth the money spent and you will save yourself in the long run because you won't need to buy more than one mirror to find one that works. It attaches securely to the wall and doesn't use suction cups so you don't need to worry about it falling off of the wall. By filling the back with hot water you eliminate the fogging and it provides the perfect reflection you need to shave. Looks great and doesn't feel cheap. My husband loves it!
  270. The Good:<br />- does not fog when used properly<br />- adjustable angle is nice<br />- easy to clean<br />- shaving in the shower seems to result in a much better shave<br /><br />The Bad:<br />- manually removing the mirror and refilling with water each time is a slight inconvenience<br />- the parts involved in the pivot motion wear down over time<br /><br />Conclusion:<br /><br />I've become spoiled. Shaving in the shower is the only way to go. I've always gotten a much better shave in the steamy shower than by standing in front of a sink.<br /><br />As for everyday shaving at home, this product is the one to have. While I liked the convenience of the shower-head-mounted type which I had used for many years, I've come to like this product better. Unlike the shower-head-mounted type, this one doesn't receive a continuous feed of warm water from the shower head into the mirror, which is actually a disadvantage of this one in my view. That shower-head-mounted type meant no constant refilling of a water reservoir with warm water. On the other hand, this reservoir type is easier to remove and clean, can be mounted practically anywhere in the shower, and doesn't introduce a water connection that is prone to leakage or random directional offspray from any number of places on the shower-head-mounted type mirrors as those units are under constant water pressure while in use.<br /><br />The only product improvement I'd recommend for a future version of this would be something like a small release hatch/gate at bottom that would allow one to release the water after using, without having to unhook the mirror, dump, and re-hook. Re-hooking is pretty effortless in itself, but I often mess up the optimum downward angle when re-attaching the unit and find myself constantly having to readjust the pitch as a result. And constant re-adjustment means wear and tear on those plastic parts which hold the proper angle. If I could pop open a relief valve at the bottom of the unit with a flick of a finger before exiting the shower, I'd keep a beaker type cup on the shower shelf and use it to refill the mirror with fresh, hot water next time I entered the shower.<br /><br />Overall, the mirror is well-worth the money given the frequency of at-home shaving we guys do and the smooth, comfortable results of shaving in the shower.h a flick of a finger before exiting the shower, I'd keep a beaker type cup on the shower shelf and use it to refill the mirror with fresh, hot water next time I entered the shower.<br /><br />Overall, the mirror is well-worth the money given the frequency of at-home shaving we guys do and the smooth, comfortable results of shaving in the shower.

  272. A fogless mirror for the shower...is there really such a thing? I was presented with the idea of this when I saw this new product. I received one and put it up in our shower to test it out.<br /><br />The Fogless Mirror is easily installed with a few double sided pieces of foam tape and some silicone adhesive. Make sure it is straight and at the right height and stick it to the wall. The surface of the mirror measures aprox. 6\\"x8\\" and has a little shelf to store the squeegee as well as a razor or two. The mirror slides on and off of the platform for easy use and filling with warm water. In order to keep the mirror fogless you fill the back of it with your warm shower water and away you go. The mirror sits on an adjustable platform that pivots up and down in about three or four different positions.<br /><br />For any man who shaves in the shower this is a great gift. They no longer have to shave blind or continually wipe off a mirror to see what they are doing. I am sure there are a hundred other things that this mirror could be used for as well. It is a great invention that actually stays fog free.<br /><br />Another idea is to place it at your kids eye level in the tub and let them have fun with it while taking a bath or shower. Kids enjoy seeing themselves. It may actually help your kids wash their hair properly and get all of the soap out!!

  281. I am overall very happy with this product. It stays on the shower wall with no problem, the mirror is a decent size (though I think I'd prefer the size of the deluxe version but not for another $20), it stays fogless and is quick and easy to fill. The little shelf for the razor is also very convenient. The only complaint I have is I started to notice white streaks all over the mirror that wouldn't go away. The instructions said not to use any glass cleaners or abrasive cleaners and to only use water and the included squeegee to clean. However, the water did nothing to remove the streaks. So I went on their website and it said it's probably due to hard water and to try using liquid car wax to clean it. I did so and it worked well. I know its not necessarly their fault, it's a combo of the material and the hard water but I do have to make sure to stay stocked up on car wax now to keep it clean. So all in all, a very good product that could be a little bigger and a little easier to clean.
  282. I love this mirror. I have not had a problem with it falling off, nor a problem with the quality of the mirror that others have stated. The only issue I've had is one that I've seen stated quite often in other reviews, and that is, upon arrival of the package, the silicone adhesive was completely dried up and hard as a rock. I had to go to the store and purchase my own. The squeegee that comes with it is pretty much useless as well, but I don't have much of a problem with too much water getting on it given the placement of it in my shower. Other than that.. I love it!
  283. $30 for a shower mirror? I know, right? But the fact of the matter is that I have spent well over $30 on many cheap mirrors that promised the world and failed immediately. Fogging up and crashing into the tub in the middle of the night, scaring the bejeebus out of me, is the norm. This mirror, if used properly, WILL NOT FOG UP, and it WILL NOT FALL DOWN. If that's worth $30 to you, grab this and you will be thrilled. So why 4 stars and not 5? Well, $30 IS a lot of money for this. Looking at it, bases on materials and complexity, there's really no compelling reason for the high price except that it's the only thing of its kind on the market. If there were a legitimate competitor, the price would probably quickly be cut in half.

  293. Overall I like this product and this may be one of the first Amazon reviews I have ever completed (out of hundreds of purchases). I was impressed by how easy the mirror was to install and it has definitely improved my in-shower shaving. It lives up to the claim that it \\"will not fog\\" (though i will caveat that water droplets collecting on the mirror may not be fog but they are just as effective at making it hard to see); however the \\"designed not to fall\\" claim has a bit of a flaw. The base of the mirror is definitely not going anywhere, short of a jackhammer I'm actually not sure how im going to get it down if i ever have to move. However, the mirror itself attaches to the base at 2 ratcheting points which allow the mirror to be angled up and down. This appears to be the product's greatest weakness. A brush from an errant towel and the mirror comes crashing down into the tub (or onto the back of your ankle....youch!). All in all i would recommend the mirror, especially if you have a spacious shower, but it would be nice if the mirror was a bit more firmly secured to the base to prevent falling.

  308. I love shaving in the shower. I always do it that way, unless I am traveling. I have purchased several supposedly fog-free mirrors over the years. None of them worked! I have had the kind you hook-up to the shower head, which connects to the water supply and trickles water down the back of the mirror, which is supposed to keep it fog-free, and it was nothing but trash. I have had several you attach to the wall. Those kind worked for about a week and then started to fog up. I was so tired of having to take the hand held shower sprayer off the holder to wash the fog off the mirror. I would have to do that several times while shaving and it was annoying (not much comes close to how annoying it was to have fog on a fog-free mirror). I was also tired of having to clean the mirror to try and get all the water spots off of it, to no avail. About five months ago I had finally had it with buying cheap fog-free mirrors that did not work. I went onto Amazon.com to see if there were any truly fog-free mirrors available. They all were just like the ones I had used before, except for this one. I read all the great reviews on it and decided to give it a try. After having it for about a week, I got a message from the seller inviting me to post a review of the product on Amazon.com. I thought to myself, \\"No way. I have only had this for a week and based on my experience with these types of products, I am going to wait a long while before I post a review.\\" Well, after that first week, I noticed the mirror was still working great. It has been about five months now and it is still working great! And for some reason, it does not accumulate annoying water spots like all the others did. I never thought I would find a truly fog-free mirror, but with this one I have. So, I decided it was time to post this review. Here are a few things about the product I would like to mention: When I first received it I thought the plastic seemed cheap and I suspected it would not hold up to wear and tear. Well, so far is has held up perfectly. I do handle it as carefully as I can, because I do not want to drop it. I take if off the bracket gently when I go to fill it up with warm water and I take my time putting it back on the bracket. It seems to me that if one handles it with care, it will last a very long time. Also, I did not use the supplied tape and adhesive. The way my shower is constructed, I was able to permanently mount it to the shower wall with two screws. I carefully drilled holes into the wall bracket to put the screws through. Guess what? The plastic did not crack from the drilling. Here is my routine: I get into the shower and get the water warm. I take the mirror off the bracket, pour out the old cold water from the last shower, fill it up with the fresh warm water, put it back on the bracket, use the supplied squeegee to get any water off the mirror, and it stays fog-free during the entire shower. Wonderful product!

  342. Fogless it is !!!!!! Nice product.
  343. The product frame attaches to the shower wall with a special silicone adhesive [needs to cure for two days before applying pressure to the mount.] Once it's set, the mirror slides onto the frame. The mirror has a reservoir behind it that you fill with water from the shower. VOILA! No steam on the mirror. Afterwards, slide the mirror up, turn upside down to empty the water, and slide back on. That's it. Only one problem I had: There were multiple vials of the adhesive provided to apply to specific areas of the product mount. One of my vials was old and congealed rendering it useless. Fortunately, I had similar heavy duty mounting adhesive on hand. Otherwise, I would have contacted the company to get me some more. The silicone adhesive is secure. I've had the mirror mounted for 5 months, taking daily showers and shaves. It is still just as secure as the day I started using it.
  344. I have been looking for a decent anti-fog mirror for some time. After seeing all the positive reviews for this product on Amazon, I decided to buy one. This is a really well thought out product and I could not be happier with it. It's all plastic construction, so for me that's a plus because I don't have to worry about cheap metal rusting in a few weeks like another product I've owned. The mirror itself is also plastic so even if you drop it, it won't break like glass. The mirror will not fog at all once the reservoir is filled with warm shower water. It's easy to mount and unmount when filling with water. The vertically adjustable mount is also a well thought out feature. Even the squeegee and squeegee holder at the base of the bracket is very well thought out. At first I didn't think it was necessary, but if there is too much water on the mirror it's a great tool to have. Installation was simple with the instructions provided. They made it obvious where to apply the silicone glue and double sided tape.<br /><br />The only thing some people may not like is the fact that it has to be glued to the wall. Personally, I was looking for something with suction cups. Although, I don't mind the fact that it has to be glued to the wall because I'm not going to move it around once it's up anyway. When you really think about it, it can't be done any other way. The best way for a product like this to consistently prevent fogging is to fill it with warm water. Unfortunately, the water adds a lot of weight that suction cups may not do a great job of holding up. In other words, you can't make a better product than this in my opinion.<br /><br />Edit 3/10/13<br /><br />The plastic has grooves that let's you adjust the vertical angle of the mirror. The problem is, that mechanism has worn over time. As a result, it doesn't stay in position when it's filled with water. I still feel that it's a good product. However, I took my review down two stars because of this issue. For the money,it should have lasted longer. Other than that, it still does what it's meant to do.<br /><br />Update: 5/18/13<br /><br />The vertical adjustment issue mentioned above got worse, it now only stays in one position. It's on the brink of completely losing its ability to stay up. This is a major problem because I will either have to find a way to try to keep it in one position permanently or replace the whole thing if it doesn't work out.

  346. The fogless portion of this mirror works great. You put hot water in the back and it never fogs up. However, the water builds up on the mirror constantly. It doesn't bead up and drip down as expected. Therefore, even though it does not fog up, it is very difficult to see your reflection. I may try to put Rain-x on it and see if that helps. Overall, it looks nice and it stays fog-free, but it leaves water droplets all over the mirror itself, which makes it very difficult to see clearly.

My shower is large (6x5) with lots of heads but steam does not seem to build up much in there. However, I did fill the anti-fogging water reservoir with warm water and didn't experience any fogging. The squeegee seemed to work OK for me. I use the built-in shelf to hold my razor and it is handy. I think I will follow the recommendation of another reviewer and drill a small hole at the base of the reservoir to let the water drip out slowly. Over all I expect to enjoy this useful and simple shaving mirror or a long time. Simple, attractive, works.<br /><br />Update 11-26-2012: I've recently had to glue into a fixed position the mirror.   353. I have now used this shower mirror daily for over a month. Over the past 30 years I have tried all sorts of mirrors to shave in the shower, the most logical place to shave. This is the best! It is a bit of a hassle to use, but less so than the others - after all, bright shiny surfaces and steam are not compatable. The clarity is excellent and it is far easier to maintain than other \\"fogless\\" mirrors that eventually require daily application of some product (anti-fog juice, soap, whatever). I've gotten into the routine of filling it after I enter the shower (it's really cool to watch it de-fog itself in 15 seconds after its been fogged up and you add warm water to the resevoir) and when I'm done I empty it and it's ready for the next time. Eventually you learn how to put your finger behind it as you find the slot it fits into and it becomes a rather simple process to get it back into its holder. Be sure to use a level when you install it as it's not worth removing and reinstalling if it's not truly level the first time. Also, I've found that in order to make the squeegee work well I do have to press rather hard - but then the mirror is clean and shiny. I am very impressed with this product and look forward to enjoyable shaving for years to come.

The positives were astounding, while the negatives were (in my opinion) minor and nitpicky. Could this be the one? I thought I'd give it a try knowing full well that if it didn't work out, Amazon would happily return my money. I received the item much earlier than expected (typical), and noticed right out of the box, I was dealing with a different animal. This is not your grandfather's fogless mirror; from the packaging of the mirror, to the solid construction frame and mounting materials, I knew I made the right decision. I followed the easy to follow mounting instructions, and had the mirror up within minutes, hassle-free. The mirror comes with a squeegee, and I questioned whether or not I needed it, but attached it anyway inside the designed slot under the razor stand. (It was apparent the manufacturer put a lot of thought into design as everything fit perfectly). The next day, I gave it a whirl. When it was time to shave, the mirror slid easily off the base, and the large opening at the top allowed the reservoir to fill quickly with warm water. I returned the mirror back to the base and waited for the fog, but nothing. Waited a little longer, nothing--it was working perfect. (I realized the value of the squeegee during shaving as water would occasionally splash on the mirror. No problem, the squeegee took care of it!). After shaving I slid the mirror off the mount, dumped the water and returned the mirror to the mount. The mount attached perfectly to the tile, and didn't move at all. All in all, the best (and only) fogless mirror you'll ever need! I've had it now for over 2 months and still working perfectly.

  396. Similar to several other reviews on this product, I have tried several versions of \\"fog free\\" mirrors from other manufacturers. I have no idea how they can call themselves \\"fog free.\\" It makes me wonder if they ever actually tested it out. This product truly is fog free. Thank you for making a product that actually does what it is supposed to do. I also really like the silicone adhesive used to install it. I have been awakened far too many times from other brands of mirrors that are installed with suction cups that decide to let loose in the middle of the night and crash to the floor. My only complaint about this product is that I have found that the squeegee does not seem to work very well. I live in Arizona and we have \\"hard\\" water, which makes it difficult to keep anything in the shower clean. If any water is left on the surface, it will leave hard water spots when it dries. In order to work around this issue, I take the mirror off of the bracket and dry it with a microfiber cloth and store it outside of the shower on days when I do not use it for shaving. Overall, this is definitely the best product of its type that I have run across and I would highly recommend it.
  397. Have had this mirror now for 3 months. Secure attachment, easily adjusted. Easily filled with warm water which indeed prevents fogging. Be careful of mirrors that claim fogless performance (I have had 2 others). Most have a film that prevents fogging but this design is flawed as the fogless effect is only temporary. This mirror is a little more pricey but as the saying goes - you get what you pay for.
  398. I have had several shower mirrors with suction cups and they all fall down after a little while. Also, those cheaper mirrors have a finish on them that goes bad very quickly. I am thrilled with it and when I called their customer service with a question, they were immediately helpful and courteous. Would not hesitate to buy their products and especially this mirror.

You can easily remove the mirror and fill it with water really easy from the shower head. The squeegee that is included is great for cleaning the mirror when droplets gather. The only issue is the mirror distorts and warp you reflection at around 3 feet distance. You have to fairly close to it.   408. This product works exactly as described!! Installation is simple, the provided directions are very clear, and the necessary glue is provided. Just glue the plastic bracket to your shower tile (the back of the bracket has grooves labeled for where the glue goes, so you can't make a mistake), wait 24 hours, and you are good to go. Taking the mirror off, filling it with warm water, and slipping it back on are very easy. There is no need to worry about the mirror falling off, and no need to worry about fog. Also, the mirror can be easily adjusted and more than enough room on the built in shelf for 2 razors. For a truly fog free shaving experience this product works great!!   410. This is the best shaving mirror I have ever used. I followed the instructions and installation was a breeze. I find no distortion and when it gets water on it, one wipe of the squeegee and I am all set. At the end of the shower, I remove it from the mount and pour out the water. It could not be any easier.   422. This mirror works just as it's advertised. Installation took 2 minutes. Keep in mind that you will have to put a bead of silicon caulk (included) on the back of the mirror mount to secure it to the wall which could leave residue if you ever decide to take it down. The mirror stays fogless as long as you take the mirror out of the wall mount (easily slides up and out), and fill the back with warm water from the shower head. Comes with a squeegee which tucks into the wall mount as well. You might want to splurge on the LED lit one if you're shower area isn't well lit. Great purchase!
  423. The mirror works great for a month or so but once you affix it to the wall you have to remove the mirror everytime you shower and put in warm water and remove the cold water. Becuase of the weight of the water, the gear that changes the angle of the mirror warps and this it doesn't stay straight anymore after a month or so of normal use. Toiletree, however, fixed this by providing me with a new part and shipping it almost next day after I left a negative review. It would have been easier to just provide contact information in the listing since it seems like this is a common issue. But at least I have my mirror working again!

  425. This mirror is great! My husband was very skeptical when I first showed him what I ordered, before it came. He just built us a large all-slate shower, and he is very picky about what goes in it, but he wanted a shower mirror for shaving. After one day, he loved it! The installation instructions are very well written, with illustrations. I do not give compliments on instructions lightly as I am a technical writer, and that's what I do for a living. The mirror attached easily to our slate shower wall. (And it is movable if needed, not permanent as some have said--you peel off the silicone and put new silicone in the new location.)<br /><br />I used the fog-free feature for the first time today--filling the reservoir with warm water. I simply lifted the mirror from the base, filled the reservoir with shower water, and replaced the mirror on the base. The mirror stayed fog-free for the entire shower (and I like it HOT)! My husband does not use this feature. He simply leaves the curtain over the mirror until he's ready to use it and then shaves. The mirror stays fog-free if it's behind the curtain and for long enough afterward to shave. (I realize that most people won't install their mirror where they can pull a curtain over it. That is just how our shower is built--one wall is a half-wall (open door) with a fabric curtain to prevent water on the floor.)<br /><br />The squeegee also works very well, but I found out that it works better when then reservoir is filled with warm water.<br /><br />My only wish is that it came with color options--bronze or black. Nothing else in our bathroom is silver.

  449. My take on this product in the order in which I dealt with it; -The mirror was easy to mount. Having a tray gave me a good place to set a little torpedo level when I stuck the bracket on the wall. Between the supplied double sided tape and the silicone, I have no doubt that it will stay in place until I remove it. -Filling the mirror is easy each time I use it. Earlier reviewers talked about doing things like using a cup to fill the mirror (there is a chamber behind the mirrored surface). I have a shower head on a long extension and figured that would be the easiest way to fill the chamber but after a couple of times, I just started removing the mirror and holding it up to the shower head. It is faster, and in my opinion easier. Both work but the bracket that holds the mirror has a U shape to it that makes the mirror VERY easy to lift up and put back. -As it says, it is fogless. The water keeps the mirror from fogging up and if you only fill the chamber halfway, you'll see that you can get half a foggy mirror! Great simple concept. For years I used shampoo or shaving creme to keep my mirrors from fogging. This is so much easier and better. -The included squeegee is a nice bonus for helping to keep the mirror clean. I don't believe you will be disappointed in this product!

My wife talked me out of it and I shaved for the last 4 years at my sink. I hated it. For father's day my wife bought me this mirror from Amazon and I thought, great another piece of crap.   469. I really like this mirror for use in the shower. I am a male and use it to shave every day. It is easy to install and works the way it is supposed to work. The issue I have with it is that the \\"gears\\" for the rotating part of the mirror are plastic and are not able to hold the weight of the water when I add the warm water.<br /><br />The mirror has a nice feature to be able to tilt it up and down. I installed the mirror a little lower so my wife could use it and I could just tilt it up for when I use it to shave. However, the plastic gears used for tilting seem to have worn over time. Now when I add even just a tiny bit of warm water to defog the mirror, the mirror tilts all the way to the low tilt angle. I have to hold the mirror's angle to my height to use it. This is frustrating and the design should account for this, since you need water (and its weight) to use it for its intended purpose.<br /><br />I would have given this mirror a 5 if not for this tilt issue. I would buy this mirror for gifts if this tilt feature were not an issue. You should consider buying this mirror, but make sure to account for the tilt issue when deciding what height to install it.<br /><br />12/21/13 update: Steve from ToiletTree Products saw my review and contacted me to offer to fix the issue of the mirror losing it's ability to maintain a tilt. He sent a replacement part that was easy to pop into place. The \\"gears\\" now catch as they should and the tilt feature now works great. I am very happy with the mirror and now revise my rating from a 3 to 5. The company did a great job in fixing a design issue and reaching out to customers to ensure they are satisfied. We should support companies like this.
  470. One year I had bought my husband a \\"fogless mirror\\", which of course did not stay fogless for long (a week). Every day was a fight for him to try and shave in the shower. Since Christmas was around the corner, I did the research and found this one which was at a very decent price. It works great. Has already been a couple of months and it's still fogless. It's a great mirror!!!
  471. This shaving mirror is great. As long as you fill it up with Hot Water it does not fog up. This is a great product, I recommend it if you are looking for this type of product.
  472. A fogless shower mirror, until now an unrealistic dream. I'm not going to write a review that states it's specs. I'm going to tell you straight out, this mirror does what it says. It's amazing. I guess I use that a lot, but my step dad had a shower mirror and let me tell you, that thing was only good for the radio. Who likes to try using a mirror in the shower that they have to splash with water every two and a half seconds. I know you all know what I'm talking about. I read reviews about this mirror and I had to laugh. Some people complained that it fogged. There is a reservoir at the back of the mirror to fill with water. If you're taking a hot shower and fill it with cold water, it's going to fog. If you are lazy like me and left the water in from the day before and thinks it might still work, it will fog. But it's extremely easy to just dump out and grab hot water from your current shower. This is how it works its \\"anti-fog magic\\". The mirror is easy to apply to your shower wall, and sturdy, no worries. It comes with enough silicone adhesive to reapply many many times and comes off without a hassle, just a good pry. I love the way it looks, it's black and silver, sleak. There is a tray at the bottom to hold the reason it's in there; shaver, tweezers etc. The mirror is adjustable, so even though it was installed for the man of the house, it can be adjusted for the much shorter woman in the house by simply tilting it down. It also comes with it's own squeegee. If your ridiculous you might think that it's broken. Life isn't perfect and it's going to take at least two or three swipes to clear the mirror, but when you get it done that's it. It's bright, beautiful and dry. My eyebrows have never been so kept and the man of the house doesn't dread shaving As much ( he has to do it Every day for work ), he used to do it After the shower but it's just tedious that way. Now he can justify longer showers. For the sake of clarity I will say that if you are too far awayfrom the mirror it looks slightly distorted. I say this as an oxy moron. Who is going to try to pluck or shave their face from two to three feet away? It only hurts the vain. Fogless shower mirror. We love that you do what you say.
  473. I use this every day, it was super easy to set up and like many others have said, the only semi-annoying thing about this unit is that you have to refill the mirror with water each use. Excellent product

  476. After a lifetime of rubbing condensation from shaving mirrors, I have found the one that really works. No B.S. You fill it with hot water, shave, dump it out and that's it. It works EVERY time. The set up was simple - before you go to bed, squirt on the silicone, press the 2 double sided tape pieces on the shower tile and tomorrow morning it's perfect for shaving. Some people wrote a in 4 Star negative \\"Well, it's not a glass mirror . . .\\" - stop your whining! What do you do, run your nails over it while you shave?   477. What a great idea. The mirror fronts a reservoir that you fill from the shower head, changing the water each time you shave. Fog is created by tiny water droplets, which are formed when the colder mirror meets the warmer water (or vice versa), adhering to dirt particles. Other fogless mirrors work by putting a slick coating on the mirror, but that eventually wears off or is coated by a film that overcomes the nonstick barrier.<br />This one works by preventing the water droplets from ever forming so it never wears out. As a scuba diver, I have learned a lot about fogged glass or metal, since we battle fogged masks all the time. We solve it by super cleaning our masks or putting on the slick surface with no fog products. I wish we could use something like this!<br /><br />The only reason I did not give it five stars is one of the three I bought broke at the hinge which allows you to tilt the mirror up and down. That could be more robust.
  478. This is a great product and if used right is fogless. I have told many friends to pic 1 up.Great service fast delivery and very good price
  479. Over three months later, it still works great! Unlike all the other &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors that end up fogging about a month after you buy them - this one STAYS FOGLESS!
  480. I purchased this mirror for my hubby. We received it very quickly and he absolutely loves it. It truly is a fogless mirror. Glad I purchased it. thanks for the fast shipment!!

  489. Since this ingenious mirror heats up with shower water, which one adds when using it, it remains fog-free during the entire shower. Some models come with built-in lighting, provided from lights around the perimeter of the mirror. I have purchased both kinds. The lighted model has a slightly larger mirror as well. Only once did I fail to turn off the light completely (it has two levels of brightness), thereby running down the batteries. Since the unit can be removed easily from its well-mounted wall attachment, changing the batteries is easily accomplished. If you like to shave in the shower, this mirror makes it easy.

  530. Let me be honest here. The mirror doesn't fog up. It actually stays clear through out the entire hot shower/bath as long as you remember to fill up the reservoir with hot water.<br /><br />Now, having said that, here's why I didn't give this mirror a 5 star rating:<br /><br />First of all, the mirror is not glass, it is made entirely of plastic and because it is all plastic, the image is distorted, unless you are pretty close to it. This of course doesn't mean glass would be a better option, because if the mirror fell, you'd have broken glass all over the tub/floor. I'm simply stating that due to the fact that the mirror is \\"plastic\\" makes its reflection distorted.<br />Also, again, because it is plastic, the squeegee that comes with it left a long scratch mark on the left side of the mirror, the very first time I used it.<br />There's not option to hang the mirror or use suction cups; you must use the double sided tape and silicone provided with the unit, this creates a problem for those whom rent or simply do not want to leave any silicon/tape residue on their tile.<br /><br />This unit, IMO, is not worth the $30+ price tag. $15 at the most, considering the issues I described above. Hope this helps.

  536. IN SHORT: This mirror is incredible and actually is totally fog-free if you follow the directions. It's worth the price if you're hesitating like I did.<br /><br />LONGER REVIEW: This mirror is the last piece of equipment I needed to complete a simple, easy shaving regimen. I've really run the gamut -- from disposable razors to those fancy \\"safety\\" razors with 5 blades, to honing and stropping my own straight razor and shaving with homemade soap. I've tried so many things to get what I want and none of them were satisfying. I love the feeling of a really close shave, but parts of my neck get irritated with safety razors, and the whole ritual of shaving with a straight razor was just too time-consuming for me. I finally bought a Panasonic wet-dry electric razor and this mirror. The electric shaver doesn't shave anywhere near as closely as a razor, but it's quick, easy, and now I can do it in the shower thanks to this mirror!<br /><br />The mirror is easy to install, easy to get on and off the bracket to fill, and the squeegee sits in a little holder on the bottom side of the mirror, out of the way. You can tilt the mirror to a few different positions, so if multiple people are going to use it in the shower, you don't have to worry about one tall person and one short person arguing about how high to place it. The mirror looks like an honest-to-god mirror, even though it's acrylic. I've had \\"fogless\\" mirrors in the past that were made of some weird material that was really cloudy and not crisp. Not this one. It seems like they thought of everything and I'm extremely glad I bought it. Shaving is now a fogless breeze in the shower! Love it!
  537. The concept works. No fog when you fill the cavity with warm water. But, how long will it last? Very cheap fragile plastic. If I had been able to see and touch before online purchase I would have not purchased.
  538. Updated September 1, 2013:<br />Well, the part that holds the mirror in position has worn out again. This time it lasted about nine months. I don't expect things to last forever, so I would not mind paying a couple of bucks to replace this piece of plastic every year since I do enjoy the mirror. The manufacturer might consider selling that piece as an alternative to the consumer having to throw away the mirror or buy an entire new unit every year - something that won't happen at the current mirror's price. Love the mirror, hate that it breaks so quickly.<br /><br />Updated June 20, 2012:<br />The customer service from ToiletTree is fantastic. Within hours of posting my review about the mirror no longer staying in place the president of the company contacted me and said he wanted to make things right. They sent out a new pivot piece along with some nail clippers and a personalized apology card. I wish all companies valued their customers like ToiletTree does. The mirror might seem somewhat pricey, but it's nice to know the company stands behind it and will make things right if need be.<br /><br />Old Review:<br />I loved this product for the first 8 months I had it. Shaving in the shower is the way to go. Unfortunately it now will not stay in position when water is added. Since water is needed to keep it fog free I now find myself shaving with one hand while holding the mirror in place with my other hand - defeating the whole purpose of the product.<br />I have always made sure to empty it when not in use, so was surprised that it wore out so quickly (I'm not an every day shaver either.)
  539. The mirror is probably the best fog free mirror I have ever owned--and I have had several over the years. Granted to truly achieve the fog free surface, the process of filling the reservoir with hot water is a bit cumbersome. I found that since I live in a very warm and humid climate year-round and have a bathroom that is more or less open to the outside, I do not have to fill it with water and it remains fog free. I just use the squeegee to wipe off any excess water post shower.<br /><br />The reason I have rated it 3-stars is that in less than a year of use the mirror has developed a defect that I believe should not exist. In the upper right hand corner there is about a nickel sized area of flaking of what appears to be the silver backing of the mirror. It appears that moisture has entered the area between the plastic backing and whatever the material is that comprise the mirror and have caused the distortion. It's not huge and does not affect my ability to use the mirror for shaving in the shower, but I am concerned the defective area will only grow larger over time. And since it is a mirror that is designed to be used in a wet environment, this defect should not have appeared.<br /><br />UPDATE 02-26-2015:<br /><br />I really have to revise my review and in hindsight give it a 5-star rating if for nothing else the company's terrific response to the only issue I had with the mirror. The company, in their comment to my review, states that it is not normal for the flaking to occur and has offered to replace it. What more can I ask? The mirror works as it is designed and except for that one flaw that developed after a few months of use, I am very satisfied with the product. (I see many reviews stating disappointment that the mirror does not stay stuck to the shower wall. I have an irregular stone shower stall and it is always difficult to get these types of products to adhere permanently. So I just drill a couple of holes and fasten to the wall with concrete screws.)<br /><br />I would also add that I recently purchased another ToiletTree product--a three container shower soap dispenser. It was expensive but it clearly is the best of the best in shower soap dispensers. However, one of the three dispensers did not work properly, so I contacted ToiletTree customer service by email and within 12 hours had a personal response from the company offering to immediately replace the one dispenser. It's nice to know that in this era of mass produced low end consumer goods, there are companies that stand out from the rest by backing their products and brand with outstanding customer service.d also add that I recently purchased another ToiletTree product--a three container shower soap dispenser.   563. There are only two reasons I didn't give this excellent mirror five stars. One is that I mounted mine on the wall of my bath/shower such that every time I want to take the mirror off and then put it back on (which is required every time you shave) I have to contort around to see where the bracket is -- behind the mirror. The instructions for this mirror should strongly encourage users to mount the mirror on the \\"front\\" wall of the shower so that when you are standing outside the shower you can see behind the mirror and easily take the mirror on and off. If I had more of that glue stuff they send I would move the mirror but they only include enough for you to mount it once, securely. It would be nice if there was a valve at the bottom of the unit so that we could open it after the shower and the water would just flow out.   569. Most shower mirrors attach to the shower using suction cups. Suction cups don't always hold well with temperature or humidity changes. And that's only if the item being held up is light. Fogless mirrors (the good ones) aren't light. You'll find out why below.<br /><br />If used correctly, this mirror will not fog, and will not fall down. The mirror is detachable from the base. The base is held to the wall of the shower with two-sided tape and silicon gel. The tape is there to hold the base in place while the silicon dries. Once the base is attached to the wall, it's not going anywhere. The mirror has a reservoir behind it that should be filled with water from the shower once it's at the warmest temperature you're planning to use. That keeps the temperature on both sides of the mirror about the same and, voila, no fog. The mirror is easily attached to the base, and the upward/downward angle can be adjusted.<br /><br />The shelf can hold a razor and comb. A squeegee slides out from below the shelf to wipe water drops from the mirror.
