  589. I will add my 5-star rating to this product, and here's why. --After years of buying shower mirrors at the big chains (Wal-mart, Target, etc.) only to have them hopelessly fog-up and become dirty after a few months, I was skeptical of the promises made by this product. I think the cheesy grin on the face of the guy in the product photo (and I found out later on the box the mirror comes in!) does not help. Toiletree should think about changing that. After a few months now of using this product, I can say it is the best shower mirror I've ever had. It's easy to use and bases its 'fogless' claim not on some chemical coating or composition, but on the mere fact that by adding water to the space behind the mirror, you bring the mirror itself to the same temperature as your shower, and thus it cannot fog. When there is no temperature difference between the air and a surface, that surface will not fog or attract condensation (or give off steam for that matter). So, it really works completely as advertised. That's rare. For those who have brought up the relatively high price tag for this item, you have a point. However, in the past 15 years, I have probably spent $70-$80 on bad mirrors that did not make me happy, so to spend $30 on a mirror that does make me happy seems worth it to me. As long as I can keep this one in good working shape, I should never have to buy another one. But speaking of keeping the mirror in good shape, the only tip that I have for anyone who buys this mirror is to resist with all your might the urge to wipe the mirror off with your hands. The little squeegee that's included with mirror is ok and gets the mirror as clean as a squeegee can get anything clean. However, I still had the urge to wipe off water spots and smudges. Don't do it! This just puts a coating of your skin oils on the mirror and makes it worse. Just take a clean washcloth, dampen it in your shower and clean the mirror off. I would definitely recommend this mirror to people like me who have had years of frustration with shower mirrors. This product will really make your day.
  590. This is a great shaving mirror. It was easy to install and never fogs up when used properly. I have tried many shaving mirrors over the years, and this one is the best by far.
  591. Had another product similar to this that was suction cup based. Eventually fell and broke. This unit is great. Fasten with silicone caulk, wiper for mirror, removable to fill with water and good mirror size. You can't go wrong with this unit.
  592. Tried many, this one is awesome for shaving in the shower. Guys, I have a ceramic tile shower with random pits all over it to make it look like stone. There are few spots for suction cups to grab. This thing ships with a generous amount of clear silicone glue (more than enough), and strips of tape to hold it in place while the glue dries. Fill the little tank with shower water, swipe the mirror with the included squeegee and it NEVER fogs up. I have hard water so I make sure the mirror is dry when I get out of the shower to prevent spots. It tilts up and down, has a shelf for the razor, sticks solidly to the wall, and never fogs... it does NOT shave you, but it does everything else you need, and properly. The supplied squeegee even has a holder built in, but the squeegee is weak for cleaning the water off after the shower. Let me say again, if you fill the tank each time (under 15 seconds in my shower), and use the squeegee to clean it dry after every shower, it will never fog and you will always have a clear view.<br /><br />18 Months later.... This mirror is still excellent, with one minor exception. The tilting feature employs the familiar plastic knobby extrusions that lock when they hit grooves in the mounted piece. Over time, the knobbies wear down and it will not stay in your favorite location. I got some silicone glue like what came with it, and glued it in the posistion I like best, erasing the irritation. It has still never fogged on me, the mirror is still 100% perfect. I squeegee off the water after each shower, it never needs any sort of cleaner, no water spots, etc. Go for it.
  593. I've been looking for a truely fogless mirror for a while. Shaving in the shower provides a very close shave without any of the razor burn. I don't even need shaving cream anymore. Just shower like normal, then turn the heat up about as hot as you can stand it, the hair seems to just fall off. Doing this without a mirror can make for some interesting side burns. Not anymore thanks to Toilet Tree.
  594. I would highly recommend this shower shaving mirror. I have had a couple (another brand) in the past that I purchased from Bed, Bath and Beyond that lasted for about 6 months. This mirror has been great.
  595. I bought this mirror based on the great reviews I've seen here at Amazon. I've used countless suction cup mirrors in the past and they always fell off the tile after a few days or the mirrors faded. This mirror lives up to its description and more.<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />* The silicon adhesive and double back tape works perfectly. I have no doubt the mirror will stay put for years to come. I'm confident the mirror can be removed and placed elsewhere (if needed) without much work.<br /><br />* The size of the mirror is perfect. I use it to shave in the morning and never need to move back and forth to see. Just the right size.<br /><br />* This mirror NEVER fogs up. Add hot water to the back of the mirror and place it back on the holder. The holder is not flimsy when you replace it on the holder.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />* Pricey, but you'll make up the cost and more by not buying mirrors over and over again. I rated it 5 stars because 10 isn't available. :D

  601. I've owned a few shower mirrors in my day, and my two biggest complaints have been that after time, they fog up, and/or they fall off the wall. I've owned this mirror from ToiletTree for over a month now, and I'm thoroughly impressed. The silicon that came with the mirror holds the mirror snug to the wall. I have a tiled shower and I didn't have any trouble getting the mirror to stick. When it comes to the fogging issue, it is impossible to get this mirror to fog up. The only downside is that sometimes I forget to pour the water out. The next morning, that water is COLD when I go to refill the mirror. :) UPDATE August 22, 2011 I've been using the mirror for a few months now, and I only have one complaint. It seems that the \\"gears\\" that control the tilt of the mirror have worn out. Now, when the mirror is filled, the weight causes the mirror to tilt all the way downward. If I try to tilt it up, it doesn't hold, and it tilts downward. Without the water, the mirror is still adjustable, but not when the mirror is filled. While I'm disappointed that the mirror does not hold it's position, it's still fog free. UPDATE September 27, 2011 Today I got home from work, and I had a package waiting in the mailbox. It seems that ToiletTree read my August 22nd update. Inside the package was a handwritten apology from Kelly Parisi, Director of Marketing, and a replacement part. This speaks volumes regarding ToiletTree's customer service. Without me asking, they resolved my issue to make sure that I was pleased with their product. Thanks Kelly!
  602. I recently purchased the Fogless Shower Mirror with squeegee by ToiletTree. It works great! I replaced a Sharper Image mirror that worked OK, but this product really does stay fogless. I really like the way it attaches to the shower wall. Most use suction cups that seem to never stay up for very long. This product comes with a small tube of silcone adheasive that you apply to the back of the bracket. Wait 12 hours for drying...and you have a great fogless mirror!

The anti-fog feature works as intended as well, requiring only pouring warm/hot water into the detachable mirror. This is simple to do, the mirror slides off/on to the mount easily, and it requires only a few seconds of letting shower water pour into the top to fill up. As an added bonus, I've moved twice now, and both times when I e-mailed ToiletTree's customer service to purchase new adhesives to mount the device, they sent it to me free of charge immediately.

  609. Most products seem to be marketed in such a way that promises much more than is actually delivered- from the \\"You've tried the rest now try the best\\" pizza boxes to the empty phrases and terms you see and hear like \\"best quality\\" \\"supreme\\" and \\"deluxe\\", but this fog-free shower mirror genuinely delivers the goods by doing what the product literature says it will do and then some. I don't get excited about products very often, or write a lot of reviews, but this mirror meets my desires so perfectly I have to share about it! The water reservoir does keep the mirror from fogging, truly. I have never had a problem seeing my face, and I really love to shave IN the shower- there is nothing quite like it, especially now that I have my first ever shaving brush, but the real problem with every other mirror I've tried has been that suction cups just don't adhere permanently and I have busted more than my fair share of mirrors- either the glass or the plastic where the suction cups attach- when they fall, which they inevitably have, they crack somewhere! This mirror uses an adhesive pad that STICKS to the shower wall, so if you have textured shower walls, it might not work so well, but my walls are smooth as glass and it stays as if it was built in from the beginning. I doubt I'll ever need to remove it, but if I do, it may leave something behind or even tear away some of the material the shower is made of, so firmly is it glued to the wall- I don't know, and hopefully won't need to find out, but it certainly isn't meant for a temporary installation, so don't bring it to a hotel or you're leaving it when you check out! The squeegee is a fun little bonus (my 10 year old discovered the convenient built in holder for it) and, if you are at all conservation minded, you can use the still warm water in the reservoir to splash on and hence rinse your face so you needn't waste it! Yup. Great product. Glad I found it. Glad I bought it. Highly recommended!

  628. I have been keeping a shower mirror in each shower for the last 15 years or so, and I have 4 showers in my house. As such, with these occasionally breaking (usually due to a fall after the failure of a suction cup or two), I have been regularly (once or twice per year) checking the \\"state of the art\\" of shower mirrors. I am pleased to report that this one is my favorite yet. First, it adheres to the wall in a more permanent way (although the silicon glue used to attach it to the wall is easily removable) than the others, and I do not expect to be picking the pieces of one of these mirrors up from the shower floor in the future. Secondly, its elegant design is such that the mirror is easily removed and re-attached thus allowing easy access to fill up the reservoir with warm water in order to avoid fogging. Third, the anti-fogging approach mentioned above works beautifully, and doesn't require the occasional re-application of anti-fogging material, which I never have ever bothered to do anyway, and Fourth, it's nicely adjustable such that people of a wide variety of heights can easily use it. The only tangible improvement I could recommend would be the addition of a battery-powered light useful enough to assist with shaving. Highly recommend.

I'm sure I'll get the hang of it over time; it just could have been better designed, to guide it back into the notch in a more effortless manner. And third, my squeegee came out of the manufacturing process slightly curved, meaning you can't just make one clean swipe. It takes about 4 or five swipes, guiding the curved squeegee to get all parts of the flat mirror surface. Overall, it seems like made a cheap product to cash in on a pretty simple idea. But yeah, it stays fogless, so whoopee.

  654. This is directed to those who use mirrors for shaving in the shower. To start with... the mirrors I've purchased prior all used suction cups (which lead to them falling 5-6ft. to the shower floor) and they all fogged (always had to cup water into my hand and splash it up against the mirror). This mirror however is different. For the application it tells you to clean the area with a little bit of alcohol and then you are able to apply a silicone gel to the back of the main unit and stick it to the wall. I let it sit over night and it was necessarily sturdy. The second piece has a reservoir in the back that you fill with water (I do this while standing in the shower because the water is already hot). Vuala. Take your handy squeegee which inserts right below the razor platform and squeegee the mirror and it's very clear. I saw another review where someone had mentioned being in a wheelchair, so I wanted to add that the mirror is adjustable for both downward and upward rotation which compensates for different height levels. Once you're finished just lift off the \\"second\\" piece and dump the water. This is a quality mirror. It's nice that I'm now able to shave certain parts of my face that other mirrors had always troubled. A suggestion for any further advancements to the product would be to add an \\"exit door\\" for the reservoir such that you would not have to dump the water by removing the attachment. Other than that I do recommend if you or someone you know is in the market for a non-fog mirror to purchase this mirror. And I will recommend this product in the future.

  665. I shave in the shower every other day including my head so a good quality mirror is essential. I was a little concerned about the unit adhering well to my shower as my tile is not smooth. Other suction cup types have fallen off my shower door at night and set off our alarm so I was looking for something to mount on the wall. I followed the preparation directions exactly and have had zero issues. To keep it clean, I use the squeegee after every shower and have only needed to use soap on it once to get a little grime off of it (after about 6 months). One trick to using the squeegee is to go slow. I was doing it too fast, which left streaks. If you go slow, the water has enough time to collect on the rubber and create a water free finish. Couldn't be happier with this great quality product.

  677. I've had this for a month and a half now and I like it. If somehow I managed to break this thing, I'd buy another one right away. The image is clear and it stays fog free. The mirror is a little distorted when you stand back from it, but you're not going to be using it at Mount Palomar. It is far clearer and less distorted than any stainless steel mirror I've seen. It is very light and easy to put up. It could be improved. It is a hassle to have to empty it, so I drilled a tiny hole in the bottom at one end. I pour very hot tap water into it and it drains itself and stays completely fog free for a 10-15 minute shower--maybe longer. The squeegee is practically useless. For the price it could have a real squeegee with rubber instead of the flimsy plastic. The mirror sticks out of the wall about 2.5 inches, so if you have a very small shower, you might bump an elbow against it and it has some sharp corners on the tray. The price is a bit high, but it has no competitor. I've never seen a product so cared for by a company president. I hope Mr. Parisi sees my criticism of his great product as constructive. UPDATE: I had to bump this up to 5 stars from 4. After reading my review the company president offered to send me an improved squeegee (see the comments). I got it two days later and it is a great improvement. Amazing. It was a very small matter, but I got a personal note from the marketing director of the company (who happens to have the same last name as the president). All businesses should be like this. I wish them great success.
  678. This is the best shower mirror ever. We have tried many from the least expensive to the most expensive (in excess of $100) and this mirror by far stays fog free the length of my husband's shower/shave.
  679. I prefer to shave in the shower but up until I hung this mirror I used the \\"feel method\\". I bought this based on the user reviews and am very pleased. From the description, I knew it wasn't glass before I bought it so I didn't expect the clarity of a glass mirror but its still very clear. If you follow the simple directions it works as described. If I was king, I probably would make it a bit larger and loose the shelf. Other than that I'm very satisfied.

  681. I purchased this product about a year ago. After 6 months of owning it, the mirror surface began to erode and the hinge mechanism used to adjust the angle of the mirror weakened to the point where the mirror would only stay in place angled very high or very low (not very practical). I called the company and told them the issue and they sent me the replacement parts (which arrived within a day or two) for free. They also included a personalized apology/replacement note in the replacement packaging. I was really impressed by their customer service. The product works great and I'm ordering a second for my second bathroom. At first I thought $30.00 was too much for this product, but you are also paying for customer service and support which, should you need, will be excellent. A few tips: * Try not to readjust the angle too much. It wears down the plastic hinge and may result in the issue I described. * Empty the water after showering so that you don't wear down the hinge. * Use the included plastic tool to wipe the mirror down after use. It will help extend its life.

In this day and age, I don't know why it came with silicone in a tube for mounting. I cleaned it all up and got the heavy duty VHB mounting tape by 3M. Much better option for mounting so if you are going to buy this, don't bother with the enclosed mounting materials and just get some heavy duty mounting tape. Works like a charm!

  715. This is the first time I have ever written a review of any product online so please bear with me. But I believe the superb product and customer service offered by ToiletTree warrants my taking the time to say something positive. I purchased their fog free mirror after going thru countless other mirrors of the same kind that failed in every instance. I was skeptical about ToiletTree's guarantee that their mirror never fogs, but I was simply desperate. Well, when I got it I was blown away over the first month with how the mirror refused to fog up no matter what. I simply could not believe it. Six months later I noticed a glaze building up on the mirror that I could not get off with water, as I was afraid to use any detergents of any kind. I called ToiletTree to get suggestions on cleaning. But when Kelley, the support person heard what was going on she immediately told me that what I was describing was unusual and that she would immediately send me out a replacement mirror free of charge. TALK ABOUT GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I told her in the meantime I will go and use some detergents or solvents to try to use my old mirror while awaiting the replacement. She told me to try and clean the mirror with White Vinegar before using any detergents of any kind. I did this and had to call her back to report that my mirror looked brand new. The White Vinegar cut right thru the soap build up and had the mirror looking as new as when I brought it. And, as represented, the mirror continued to remain fog free, but this time minus the dingy build up of soap scum that I allowed. I have since learned that to prevent soap build up apply a light coat of car wax on the mirror and that should remedy that problem. Soap scum has nothing to do with the fog free aspects of the mirror. I asked Kelley to put me on ToiletTree's mailing list and alert me on the introduction of their new products because for the first time I found a company that put out products that live up to their claim----along with great customer service

  718. This product works exactly as promised. Installation was very simple - the hardest part was deciding the best spot for it. I was relieved to find that it is, in fact, removable and will not damage the tile. It took me about 3 minutes to install. Use - I was also concerned it might be a pain to empty and fill it with warm water each time but it turns out to be not a big deal at all. It's designed in such a way that getting it back on is dead simple. Great accuracy isn't required because the slot it slides into actually guides the mirror into place. If you're worried about the effort involved in using it, don't. The thing simply works. Dump out the cold water and fill it back up with warm water. It takes just seconds. Use the little squeegee that's provided if you want a mirror completely free of any water drops. Maybe $30 is a little more than I would have like to have paid, but it works so well and I think it will last for so long that I have no concerns about having spent the money. I'd recommend it to anyone.

  722. I learned the benefits of shaving in the shower early on, so I've gone through many different shower mirrors. Most have had suction cups which somehow always seem to fail in the middle of the night. Since most shower mirrors are not glass, they do not shatter, but the plastic housing does break apart after frequent falls on the shower floor. This mirror is different in that it uses a different mounting system - not suction cups. It uses a silicone adhesive and double sided tape to adhere the mount to the wall. If you follow the simple instructions, this mirror should not fall off. Of course, it's important that you clean the surface where it will be mounted.<br /><br />The other issue with shower mirrors is dealing with it getting fogged up. Although many mirrors state they are fogless, they are typically just treated with a coating that eventually wears off. What interested me most about this mirror was the unique method it uses to keep the mirror from getting fogged. Before using, you just fill the back of the mirror with hot shower water. It takes about 5 seconds to do, but beats having to constantly throw water at my old mirror. I have never had this mirror fog up. This seems like a simple idea, but the execution was genius. The fact that they also included a small squeegee shows how much thought was put into its design.<br /><br />Before purchasing the ToiletTree mirror, I read many of the reviews on here and was pleasantly surprised to see that company makes a concerted effort to help customers with any issues they may have with the product. This says a lot about the company.<br /><br />This is a great mirror which seems to resolve the two main complaints of shower mirrors, unreliable suction mounts and fogging. I highly recommend it.

  727. Hi, This mirror works great! Attached to tile wall with no problems, sturdy, doesn't fog. Very pleased after many years of wanky fake fogless mirrors...<br /><br />Some suggestions to the company to make it even better:<br /><br />-Perhaps you could add a little \\"ramp\\" to the \\"female\\" receiver slot on the wall mount- to help guide the \\"male\\" post into the slot. I find that, because this connection is being made blind (behind the mirror), it can be a little hard to line up the male and female slots, which sometimes results in the male catching on the lip of the slot, or missing it entirely. Seems like the molded top part of the female receiver slot could be widened and sloped, rather like a funnel, to better \\"catch\\" the male.<br /><br />-Along the same lines, if you made the male post on the back of the mirror \\"double ended\\", that is- exposed and rounded the top edge of the post to be symmetrical to the bottom- it would allow the mirror to be mounted UPSIDE DOWN, which would be a great option for storing the mirror in between uses so that the reservoir could drip dry. (My mirror is mounted directly below my shower head and the empty reservoir will sometimes partially fill with drips from the head afterwards, possibly leading to a mildew situation- it'd be great to be able to store the mirror upside down to prevent this!)<br /><br />-Please consider adding a cutout to the bottom shelf, to allow a razor or toothbrush to be hung! A simple 1/2\\" circle drilled close, and open to, to the edge would allow a razor to be securely stored. My razor has fallen a few times just balanced on the shelf...<br /><br />Hope these ideas might be inspiring! Thanks for the great product, it is filling a real void in the market!

  763. I've tried shaving mirrors with a \\"fogless coating\\" from various mall stores for years and they always stay fogless for a few days at best. I had read that the only way for a shaving mirror to actually be fogless is if it stays warm, which means connecting it to the shower head so that some hot water is drawn through it. But I need a mirror at the other side of the shower -- how can you shave if your face is under running water?<br /><br />This is a simple, brilliant solution that works perfectly: take a regular mirror that can be mounted anywhere and put a small reservoir right behind the glass so you can just fill it with warm water at the start of the shower. The mirror stays clear through the whole shower, and looks much better than the plastic models from stores which cost twice as much! Best of all, it stays firmly attached to the shower with an adhesive gel rather than a gimmicky suction cup that will work for the first week or two.
  764. This product is worth it! Had tried a $15 fogless shower mirror from Target that did manage to not fog up . . . For a few days. A few months later of having a worthless mirror in the shower I decided to order this one thanks to all the positive reviews. The old one was pitched in the recycle bin (I hope it was recyclable . . .) Anyway there was a little more involved in the setup of this mirror than the other mirror for sure. That mirror used suction cups (which never let go I will say) while this mirror uses silicone adhesive and double sided sticky tape (sets of both are included) I cleaned the area with Clorox wipes, let that dry, put the sticky tape and silicone gel on the mounting bracket (have about half the silicone gel tube left over after applying what appears to be the recommended amount) and let sit for 24 hours. No issues with this holding the mirror up at all. Very solid. That said make sure you like where you're going to put it and that you mount it straight. This is not something you move easily. This fogless shower mirror is something you forget about at that point however. In order for this mirror to not fog you MUST fill it with hot water. I guess this equilizes the temperature to prevent fog? Not sure the science of it. Anyway, this works best if you have a nozzle that concentrates the water otherwise you might want to take it to the bathroom sink to fill. It works perfectly but I'm not without a gripe . . . The water is just sitting open in the mirror and I found it's easy to forget to dump it at the end of the shower. This isn't a huge concern but still water is where certain kinds of insects like to reproduce. May be an unfounded fear but it's on my mind so I do my best to empty it when done. I'd suggest a lid but that would be a point of potential failiure (either an extra piece to lose or a mechanical lid that can break) which I think Toiletree is trying to avoid. Aside from that I do feel this product is worth five stars and worth your money. It's a simple design that just works. It's not relying on any special coatings that would wear out over time (at least not that I'm aware of) so this should be something you buy once not multiple times over which seems to be the case with competing products. One replacement for the $15 mirror I had before would mean my total outlay exceeded the cost of this product not to mention the waste produced by a worthless product. Don't waste time and money, go with something that just works. This product is it.
  765. I admit when I saw that this shower mirror says \\"Designed to be fogless for a lifetime,\\" I was skeptical. I have purchased my husband numerous so-called \\"fogless\\" frames and they all fog up! I also have had the problem in the past with the mirrors falling off because they didn't stick to the tile good enough. The ToiletTree Fogless mirror uses silicone which is like a glue substance that you stick on your tile and then you attach the mirror, and it is holding it. I have had it up now for a week and it is not going anywhere! I also don't think I will have a problem removing the mirror if I want to as the silicone seems pretty flexible and is clear so it won't leave a residue. To use the mirror all you have to do is lift it off, fill it with hot water and snap it back on. The hot water is the trick as that is what keeps it from fogging up! Then if you do get spots on it or didn't fill it with hot water, just use the attached squeegee to wipe it clean. The shelf that is included also holds at least 2 razors so it is a nice size shelf.<br /><br />Overall, this is definitely the best Fogless Mirror I have seen so far and I really do recommend it. So far it is working great for us and with features like an adjustable frame, shatter proof, rust proof, easily attaches to tile, and a shelf, the mirror just keeps getting better!

Simple physics. Simple product.

  791. I have scanned many of the other reviews and there isn't much I can say that hasn't already been said; but I can simply add my voice to those others by saying that it works great and I love it. If you take the time to properly prep the mounting surface per instructions, you should never have to worry about the mirror falling (as had happened to me many times with other mirrors). As an engineer, I appreciate the simple science behind the mirror, which is that fog is caused by a temperature gradient (hot steam clashing with a cool mirror). With warm to hot water in the trough behind the mirror, the temperature gradient is reduced and it is impossible to fog up. I can't express enough how wonderful it has been to be able to properly see my face again while shaving. The mirror piece slides in and out of the holder very easily and feels very sturdy in place. Even if you are lazy and don't fill it with water before you get in the shower, just pull it out and stick under the shower head for a few seconds (to fill the reservior) and you'll be all set. I especially love the shelf for my razor and the built-in squeegee is a nice touch too. There just is no reason to buy any other type of \\"fogless\\" mirror, because no other mirror can really do it as perfectly as this one does.
  792. The no fog action actually works with the warm water in the canister. Easy installation, very littel cleanup if any, very satisfied, would definitely recommend.

Keep a cup in the shower to fill this with.<br />2. For now I'm updating the review from 1 to 5 stars for stellar customer service. I'll find out soon how good their fix is, but at the very least they take good care of their customers... another update will follow...<br /><br />Nice mirror, at first.<br /><br />The mirror pivots to allow for your height. The angle is controlled by three teeth that sits in three of a line of notches. You push it to adjust, and then it is supposed to hold that position. That works well when the mechanism is new, but over time (six months or so), the teeth and notches, being made of soft plastic for some reason, wear down and round off. And then the mirror won't stay where you put it, but just drops to the lowest setting.

  836. This is indeed an amazing mirror, but for those with contacts like me who don't wear them in the shower, this may not be worth the money. I'm thinking of not using it because the mirror over the sink with my contacts in is actually much easier. That said, I imagine this would be the case with any shower mirror. Silly me, I simply did not think about this when I bought it, so be aware.

  840. I decided to give this a try because of all of the great reviews. I've now had it a little over 3 months and the friction lock that allows you to angle the mirror has stopped working. They are just some small plastic teeth that are supposed to hold up a mirror filled with water. My mirror will now stay in only two positions, angled downward or all the way up. So much for having a usable shaving mirror. I definitely don't think this was worth the price. What a shame, I really liked it when I first got it.<br /><br />Update 9/15/13: The day I posted this review, I received an email from the owner of the company apologizing for the problem and offering to send out a replacement part to fix it. Somehow I missed his email and never saw it. Two years later someone made a comment about this review and when I read that comment I saw Steve's original email. It was 2 years later so I wasn't sure what would happen but I decided to email him back. He was very courteous in his reply and reiterated his offer to send me a replacement part. I just received it and installed it and am excited to see how it holds up. I bumped my review up from a 1-star to a 3-star based on the customer service alone (by far the best I've seen on Amazon). I'm going to test how the replacement holds up and if it keeps working longer then I'll be back bumping this review up even higher. At the very least, buying something from ToiletTree means you'll receive prompt replies to your concerns and a genuine desire to make sure you are happy with your purchase.

This product is so simple and easy and does just what it says it does.<br /><br />Everything is easy, just slide the mirror off to fill it with hot water, slide it on to have it back on the stand, you can also mount it to the wall through hackery if you'd like.<br /><br />The squeegee works if you want, but I prefer just to wipe it off with my hands and I can see just fine, of course, perfection takes the squeegee but I rarely care about that.<br /><br />My ONLY issue is that there is no designated spot for the squeegee, you can put it on the &#34;shelf&#34; but then it takes up the room for your razor or whatever else you use. I generally keep the squeegee put up or in the water compartment of it because I don't really need nor want it.<br /><br />Although, BEWARE! You fill the mirror with warm water which lets keeps the mirror from fogging at all. Forget to fill it? No worries. Rinse the mirror with water, fill it with hot water, and use the squeegee and you're good to go. This is the best and last shower mirror I will own. I do not forsee ever using anything else.
  933. I have tried a few shower mirrors claiming to be &#34;fog free&#34; but none of them lived up to that claim. I like everything about this mirror. It's very easy to install, stays put, easy to fill and empty, and really is fog free once hot water is in the container on the rear of the mirror. It's also bigger than my previous mirror but still small enough for my shower. I have no complaints at all. It is such a hassle to keep wiping a mirror when you are trying to shave. This mirror saves time and makes for a better shave because you can actually see what you are shaving!<br />I do have one suggestion: add a double razor holder on the mirror instead of a shelf. Family members often have more than one razor in the shower and this would just add to the overall functionality of the mirror. Again, just a suggestion.
  934. It does what it says: if you do not forget to fill it with hot water before use it does not fog. It stays firmly attached to the wall dthanks to the included glue. It's one of those rubber type glues so you can always remove the mirror if you want to. The included rubber cleaner on the bottom is very convenient. Since mirros nowadays are made of plastic, I've scratched many of them while cleaning. This included rubber cleaner prevents the scratching. If your bathroom is not lit enough, you can get the model with lights 'http://www.amazon.com/Squeegee-ToiletTree-Products-Guaranteed-Designed/dp/B005OSQGN8/ref=pd_sim_bt_3?ie=UTF8&refRID=1T6KVTSK1MYQQTM33W41'
  935. Easy to install -- do what they say regarding cleaning the mounting surface and letting the adhesive dry.<br /><br />After that, it's simple. Fill with water, brush squeegee down surface to clear droplets, and you're off. I considered the higher end model with LED lights (and larger), but this is plenty big and, unless your shower is dark, the LEDs are not needed.
  936. It's a great product that will last for ~2 years, but is a hassle to remove (and sometimes causes damages.) I've owned three of them over the past ~5 years and can now write a pretty comprehensive review.<br /><br />Let's start with the good. Shaving in the shower is great, and this product makes it super easy. The set up is easy and while it isn't super clear, it works more than well enough to shave with. The company also will send free mounting kits if you decide to move.<br /><br />Now the bad. Over time, the mirror becomes less clear (but still usable.) The tilting mechanism wears out in a few years which is the biggest flaw. Once filled with water, there is no way to position it between the middle setting and the bottom setting without it 'falling'. I contacted ToiletTree and was ignored. Last, it is advertised as removable but be cautious. I've mounted it on tile and twice on plastic. The second time on plastic is bonded so well (and the plastic was so weak) that it ripped a huge hole in the shower wall. My landlord will not be happy.

  967. I've been shaving in the shower for many years and tried many different mirrors. All but two have failed, this being one that didn't. The other was attached to your water supply so the hot water could continually heat the rear of the plastic reflective surface. Worked great for about a year and then started to leak. Switching to this one was easy...works great. I didn't use the provided adhesive, though. I have a fiberglass shower and was afraid the silicone may not remove cleanly. I opted for 4 each 3M water resistant Command Adhesive strips. Each is rated for 5 pounds. I did remove the two squares of tape from the unit as well. May not be an issue on tile, but I didn't want to chance it.

  984. I've had this product for over a year now and am pretty happy with it. Product works great--no fog, stays stuck to wall, and I'm getting the closest shaves I've ever had. I would give it more like 4.5 stars instead of 5 for reasons below...<br /><br />The only (minor) complaints I have are from the land of first-world problems, but I'll voice my complaints anyway since that is what we do here... hopefully the company takes some notice for the next generation.<br /><br />1) Squeegee requires 2 hands: first, the squeegee is a MUST. This will not work without squeegeeing the mirror off--it gets covered in water droplets during the filling process. And, the squeegee really only works if you use two hands (one on each end). It fits cleverly along the shelf (out of sight), but that means there is no handle--just a long plastic rod and piece of rubber. Anyway, the few times I've put some shave gel into one hand and realized I hadn't squeegeed yet led to some awkwardness trying to get the water off the mirror without losing the shave gel. (yeah, I know, cue the violins! LOL)<br /><br />2) Color Scheme: It looks good enough if you had some sleek modern city bathroom with chrome everywhere, but for my bathroom, which is all earth tones and brushed nickel, the black and silver on this thing kind of sticks out like a sore thumb. I don't usually give too many tours of my bathroom, so I'm okay with it, but if I had the choice, a nice earthy color would have been perfect.<br /><br />3) Brand Name makes me think of--eeewww: Okay, while we're at it... \\"ToiletTree\\"??? I get the clever wordplay. If you are trying to envision a tree whose 'fruits' are toiletry products, great--good marketing idea. BUT, the actually logo is of a tree, whose trunk is a toilet! So every time I look at the mirror, I think, 'this company wants me to take a &*%^ on them...' and then I have a chuckle and proceed to fill one hand with shave gel... [darn! I forgot to squeegee!]...

  1005. Great idea, easy to use, and does exactly what it says - If you're looking for a fogless mirror to put in your shower, this one simply works!<br />The details: It comes with a silicone glue to mount to your shower , and once in place stays put. The mirror lifts off it's base/wall mount easily so you can fill the hollow body with water from the shower (it takes all of 10 seconds to fill with the shower running). Once you slide the mirror back into the mount, there's a squeegee (you can just barely see it under the razor in the pic) that slides out of a built-in holder which you use to wipe the mirror. Wipe, replace squeegee, and you've got a clear, fogless mirror for as long as you're in the shower. Brilliantly thought out design, and highly recommended!

I didn't mind, I feel like 2 years for a $30 investment is well worth it. I spend more on shaving cream/razors over that period of time and I have to shave in the shower to avoid breaking out. This was a wonderful mirror and helped me to accomplish that during the two years that my old one was being used.<br /><br />With that said, I have now purchased two of these mirrors since June, 2013. The first one came and was great for a month or two, but it started to develop an inch wide white line across the top (the reflective surface was peeling off), it leaked, and it eventually warped. None of my habits had changed and the water that I fill these with is the same water that I am showering in. I'm not super heating the water or doing anything that should cause this now, and wouldn't have caused it in the old mirror. I got a hold of Amazon and they said that they would make an exception for me and extend the 30 day return period (This is why I shop at Amazon! Awesome customer service!) and allow me to return the product. I figured that I probably just got a bad egg, so I ordered a new mirror (still same one) expecting to be able to use the box to return my defective one. Well, the new mirror came and guess what? It leaks, too. Not just leaks, but has a constant drip that is very obvious. Within 5 minutes there is already fog developing where the water line no longer reaches. I guess I'll be returning two of these, now. I'm pretty disappointed as I have recommended this mirror to a number of people and I really hope this didn't happen to any of them. I might give it another shot, but my patience with this sort of thing are running thin. I don't enjoy going to the post office to continually return thesame product because a company isn't maintaining quality.<br /><br />With that said, if you happen to get one of these mirrors that works it is a great addition to the shower. You'll be very happy that you invested in it and will not regret it. However, it seems to me like the odds are against you getting a quality experience right now.<br /><br />Update 1/16/2014:<br />After contacting the company I was very impressed with their response time and quality of customer service. They responded to emails very quickly and were eager to make this right. I give the company and the people working at it (family owned) 5 stars without hesitation. They were amazingly easy to deal with and I wouldn't have any problems making a purchase from them again! After contacting them they sent me a new mirror to replace the one that was leaking all over the place. This was free of charge and completely on their dollar. Unfortunately, it is with a bit of regret (I have been avoiding writing this because I don't like to taint a good name, and the number of leaking mirrors that I've gone through is starting to get a bit unreal) that I have to write that I am 3/3 so far as mirrors leaking. Fortunately, the latest one only leaks marginally (it lasts a whole shower, unlike the last one), but that's how my first one started and it only got worse until the top quarter of the mirror became a non-reflective white line. As I said earlier, the company itself is phenomenal, they go out of their way to make their customers happy. Unfortunately, I'm either getting all of the refurbished leaking mirrors, or there is a problem with quality inspection on the production line. I'm guessing that it's the latter of the two.<br /><br />I'm happy to keep using the mirror until it dies, but considering that I owned one for two years without a hitch, I'm scratching my head about the short lifespan of the current mirrors. I've tried pinching the back and front together to see if there was a problem with the way that they were put together, but no such luck. It appears as though it's just going to keep dripping until it either gives out, or I go and plug the seam with some gorilla glue or something along those lines. I'm sad to say it, but but getting three out of three leaking mirrors within the past year indicates something more than bad luck (maybe extremely bad luck?) and I hope that Toilettree gets it fixed so that I can continue to enjoy their mirror products!

  1049. I acknowledge that this works as it's supposed to, and its design is attractive. I have the brushed steel looking one which matches our other brushed steel / brushed nickel in our bathroom. I think it comes in black or white as well.<br /><br />Let me describe how to use the devices:<br /><br />1. when you're in the shower, you reach up and lift the &#34;mirror&#34; part off of the base which is glued to your shower wall.<br />2. hold the &#34;mirror&#34; (which has a water receptacle on the back of it) under hot water for maybe 15 seconds to allow it to fill with hot water<br />3. put the mirror back on the base by trying to line up some notches on the back of the mirror with some vertical guides on the base. This isn't terrible difficult, but does take a little concentration and sometimes 3-4 tries to get it on right.<br />4. at this point the mirror should stay fog free for the forseeable future (as long as the water in the mirror receptacle is warm)<br />5. when you're done showering, dump the water out<br /><br />I'm not so sure this is a better solution than just wiping the fog from a &#34;normal&#34; mirror a couple times while you're shaving.<br /><br />That said, I already installed mine and it looks pretty good, so I'll leave it there. Whatever. I probably wouldn't order it again though.

  1051. I love this mirror. It was easy to mount on the shower wall per the instructions, and filling it with hot water from the shower immediately clears the steam, and the mirror stays perfectly clear the entire time it takes to shave. It is easy to fill, easy to empty, easy to clean water droplets with the squeegee. My only quibble, for which I did not deduct any stars, is that the adjustable tilt feature is hard to adjust. In fact I adjusted it for myself before I mounted the mirror. I would recommend this product to anyone who likes shaving in the shower.

  1059. I have been using fogless mirrors in the shower for years.   1060. I was skeptical of this mirror as all others did not last long. I have a tiled shower with uneven surface tile. I went through a half dozen suction cup models over the years. They do not last long. You will hear a loud crash when the cups fail and find the mirror in a dozen pieces on the shower floor. This model uses a synthetic clear adhesive to attach the mount to the wall. They give you plenty of adhesive. There are lines where you apply the adhesive to the mount. When you push and squeeze it to the wall, the adhesive is forced out with a total seal. You just wipe up the excess while it is still wet. I used a small level to make sure it was even. You have to fill the top of the mirror with warm water to keep it from fogging up and it slides onto the mount. I have used this mirror for over six months and it is working great. You can even adjust the tilt a bit. I will purchase another one for the other shower. Good luck.

  1068. This product is made entirely of plastic and some non-glass reflective surface, which has both pros and cons. The pros are that it is light weight and with the securing adhesives provided is extremely unlikely to fall from where it is mounted. It also will not rust, and the reflective surface will not shatter. The reservoir based design seems to work well; I have not experienced any fogging. The cons are that the product looks and feels a bit cheap, and even noting the innovative design does not seem a good value at $30. That being said, I have not found a better replacement and plan to keep and continue using this product.<br /><br />As a side note, I found shaving in the shower had some challenges - mainly poor light compared to my bathroom mirror and using a lot of water if I kept the water running while I shaved. I have gotten better shaving in the low light and now turn the shower off and have a cup to rinse my razor. One big plus - my wife and I no longer fight over sink space in the morning and rinsing off in the shower is very quick and easy.

  1076. I have had this mirror for about a month, and I am very happy with it. All plastic construction means it won't rust. The mirror is large and very clear and the included squeegee helps keep it from getting spots. You affix this to the shower wall using two small pieces of double sided tape and silicone adhesive. I believe the double sided tape is there just to hold it in place while the silicone adhesive drys. The silicone adhesive means it won't fall off the wall in the middle of the night, like a suction cupped mirror would, but you do need to sure of the mirror placement when you stick it up. Overall, I am very happy with this mirror and would recommend it to anyone who likes to shave in the shower.

  1084. I researched shower-ready shaving mirrors and decided against those that came with fog-resistant coatings and required re-application of a coating you had to purchase (and rely on the supply to remain available.)<br /><br />This mirror works on a simple principle, which, in reading some of the negative reviews, some people aren't following.<br /><br /> Behind the mirror is a small reservoir that takes about 3 seconds to fill with warm water in the shower. Fill it up and the mirror will not fog. That simple. It even comes with a squeegee so you can wipe away the water droplets. It's works every time.<br /><br />My only two issues are: a) I wish there was just a tad of magnification on the mirror so you can see your neck &#34;closer&#34;, and b) the mounting stand is quite big, so it takes some room in a small shower. I wish they had designed a way you could hang or mount the mirror itself without using the stand. The squeegee fits fine in the reservoir and my razor already has a home in the shower caddy,<br /><br />Otherwise, this mirror is the real deal and if it doesn't work for you, you didn't read the directions!

  1101. This is a shower mirror what can you say... Well this one lets you say quite a bit.<br /><br />When I was looking for a mirror I wanted something that was going to let me cut my hair with my clippers as well as shave my face, so the mirror needed to pivot. Check!<br /><br />I really hate using those tiny mirrors where you constantly need to adjust the mirror or yourself every time you move out of a 3 or 4 inch area. This mirror is one of the biggest I have found.<br /><br />The last thing I was looking for was anti-fog, I like to shave in the shower after warming up my face under the water so this needed to be able to keep from fogging up. I have used anti-fog mirrors in the past and they don't stay fog-less for log so I was not expecting much in this department. This unit shines in this area, the mirror slides off its wall mount and you fill it up with hot water from the shower/tub and within a few seconds it is the same temperature as the shower thus no fog.<br /><br />The only negative I have for this product is that it feels a bit flimsy, it has not given me any issues in terms of cracking or breaking but it feels like the plastic frame should have been a bit thicker.<br /><br />If you need a good shower mirror that is not going to fog this is the unit you have been looking for!
  1102. I had a suction cup shower mirror that stuck well to my shower door, but it required a spray to keep clean and stay fog free with more \\"deep cleanings\\" every 3-6 months or so. I still expect to have to perform the deep cleans on this mirror, but no recurring charges or expenditures to buy more spray. I was a little concerned when I bought the mirror because I wasn't 100% sure it was going to work (despite mostly very good reviews) and the initial price was more than the cost of a cheap suction cup mirror. However, there is a reason why. The mirror quality is very good and the build quality seems to be excellent. (Only on week 2 so far.) My other concern was that even if the mirror did work, I thought that having to fill it with hot water from the shower head would take forever and be a pain. This is absolutely not the case. It only takes about 15 seconds to fill with my head and spray pattern and there is absolutely no fog build up. Even with the fog less sprays on my el' cheapo mirror, there was still fogging around the edges usually. This mirror stays fog free across the entire surface for quite some time. In fact, so long, I haven't seen fog on it unless two cases exist. The first case is during the shower and I haven't filled it yet. The second case is also during the shower and I realize that I forgot to pour it out after I was done using it during the last shower and the water is cold. Both cases are a no brainer and to be expected - it's called science. Mounting requires no screws, only silicone adhesive (which is provided) and some double sided adhesive squares (also provided) to hold the mirror in place while the silicone adhesive (primary mounting force) has time to cure. Instructions state specifically not to rely on the adhesive squares alone so don't run that experiment. I debated on whether or not to use some water/humid environment rated Command (a registered trademark of 3M) adhesive strips from 3M but decided to go ahead with the manufacturer's recommendations. However, if you are considering using the 3M Command strips like I was, I think they would work just fine. Especially if you used 3 or 4 of the 6 lb rated ones (I like overkill as a form of cheap insurance in some cases), but I didn't want to have to figure out how to angle them and have the ends (which you have to pull on to easily remove the 3M strips) sticking out and showing when the mirror was on OR off for filling. I highly recommend this mirror. If that ever changes, I will revise this review.

So if you don't need to move it, get this one instead of the traveling one.<br /><br />You don't even need to use warm water. As long as the water is the same temperature as your shower, there's zero fog. Highly recommended. You won't be disappointed. It's so easy to refill the water.   1109. I have been through many fogless mirrors. They all worked based on some type of coating technology. Problem is it always wears off. This fogless mirror works on simple physics! The hot water placed behind the mirror keeps it from foging. The best part is, PHYSICS ALWAYS WORKS. So this will be the last fogless mirror you purchase. It works perfectly, and will continue to work perfectly forever. I am thrilled to have found it. One consideration, you must fill the container (takes all of 15 seconds) each time it is used. You use water, and to households which hard water is pumped into there is a big problem. The mirror after only 4 uses is filled with hard water stains, at this rate nothing will be visible by 3 or 4 months. The squeegee was horrible to use but I made sure of wiping the water away each use.

  1160. chose this because I've had a shower mirror before that used running shower water to stay fog free. I was amazed when I used it to find that even once the water you fill the mirror with has become tepid, there is still no fogging. I take long showers and I've yet to see this mirror fog. other benefit is this design means that it'll last a long long time.<br /><br />I love that the mirror portion detaches so you can fill it, and the included squeegee works well.<br /><br />My gripes are very small, but there are two of them. I would really, really prefer a glass mirror to the plastic one. within a foot, there is no distortion, but two feet away it gets a little funhouse-mirror-ey. it's no problem for the user, as when you're shaving, you shouldn't be that far away from the mirror anyways.<br /><br />My second gripe is that I wish the squeegee was the exact width of the mirror, not about 80% of it. it'd be nice to only have to run the squeegee along the mirror once instead of twice. but again, it's only a minor quibble.<br /><br />Read the instructions and use the silicon adhesive as well as the pads, and this thing is SECURE. I can't use suction cups because I have the most microscopically textured tile in my shower, so I am thankful for the design.<br /><br />all in all, this is the best shower mirror on amazon. if they could fix those two little design quibbles if they ever decide to redesign this thing, I'd be blown away.

  1162. This is my second shower mirror purchase in two years, first one was different manufacturer and design. It had suction cups, a metal frame and nice mirror. However, the mirror stopped looking so good, would always fog up and the suction cups were temperamental where it would stick and then not stick. Someone stole old trusty while I was on vacation so I needed another mirror and found the Fogless Mirror with Squeegee. So here I open the box and find everything I need to stick it in the shower, complete with clear silcone RTV to glue it on. There are two double back stickems on the back to get it in place and hold it and then the silicone glue cures and gives it the extra strength to hold the mirror on with a small quantity of warm water that you put in which keeps it from fogging up. It works and the mirror is easy to line up and drop into the grooves that hold it. There is an adjustment that allows you to move the mirror up or down; I mounted the mirror at my face level however if someone shorter or taller used the mirror, they could adjust the tilt to suit their height. There is a little shelf under the mirror for the razor; this works great however because I am on a ship and it is rocking and rolling today, the razor fell off but this won't happen in a normal home environment unless you are living over a sinkhole and the bottom falls out.
  1163. I've been enjoying this mirror for a while but a chronic issue has now come up.<br />The fogless aspect of the mirror is great and it works - far better (and durably) than any other &#34;fogless&#34; mirror I've had.<br />The issue that has developed is with the strength of the &#34;hinge&#34; on which the mirror hangs and allows the vertical height to be adjusted.<br /><br />There is no instability in the device itself and no concern it will fall, but with a chamber full of water (to create the fogless mirror) the weight of the mirror slowly weakens the plastic hinge such that when it's full of water it can only be in the most dependent position and, probably, looking down at your neck or chest. The only options to deal with this that I've found are to bend down to shave or to put less water into the chamber and try to make the lighter mirror/water combo stay in a useful position.<br /><br />It's a frustrating problem but I guess not entirely unexpected given the reasonable price of the product.

I placed the bottle BEHIND the lower edge of the mirror. Luckily, the angle of the tilt, with the little bottle behind it was perfect. The little bottle has its permanent home BEHIND the mirror and props up the mirror to the perfect angle. I no longer use the pre-shave oil - but I am confident my mirror will go on forever. I am sure a small plastic pill container would work just as well....

I was going to give this review 4 stars because I find the squeegee that it comes with pretty weak when it comes to removing the water droplets, but I decided to go with the 5 stars instead because none of the other shower mirrors even come with a squeegee and this one truly does not fog up or fall off the wall - I've had it almost two months now. I've never had one that didn't start fogging up after the 3rd week and the only other one I had that didn't fall off the wall was hanging by a cord (from a nail I pounded in the wall above the shower wall because I couldn't stand getting woke up in the middle of the night by the thing crashing at the bottom of my bathtub - it worked, but it made my bathroom look like tin pan alley). My recommendation to the manufacturer would be to make a higher end model with a light built in both sides (note: the light would be on both sides as opposed to just having one light at the top -- when you're shaving, light falls right behind hot water and a sharp blade in order of importance). The light in my bathroom is above the sink, not on the ceiling, so I can only use this mirror to shave when it's light outside. Problem is, I've yet to find a shower mirror with a light that actually works for more than a few months without going dead completely or turning into a disco light, so unless the manufacturer can make a lighted one that works, they may not want to ruin their record because, right now, they are batting 100% as far as I'm concerned. Excellent product - thank you.
  1182. When you read the instructions on having to wait 24 hours for the silicon to dry and then filling the container with shower water and finally using the squeegee to clean the mirror, you can't help but to think \\"Do I really need to be going through all this effort for a fog free shave?\\". The answer is.. ABSOLUTELY. The truth is this thing is designed perfectly. You hop in the shower, you hold the removable mirror under the shower water for a few seconds to fill the reservoir behind the mirror, you put the mirror back, grab the squeegee and clean it off one time. That's it.. done. Takes no more than 10 seconds and you literally get a fog free mirror for the entire shower. No more throwing water at the mirror to get a clean view of your face. Simply an amazing product.
  1183. [[VIDEOID:mo1KANRIQNDPA13]]I am very excited to share with you about the Fogless Mirror by ToiletTree Products. This mirror claims it will not fog over during your shower and I couldn't wait to see this for myself. First is the installation. You need to clean the spot you want to hang it at and let it dry, once dry clean it with rubbing alcohol and let it dry. After it is dry you are ready to hang your mirror. They use a combo of adhesive tape and silicone glue. It then needs to set for 24 hours. After that you are ready to go. It was very simple to install. Next is testing it. I took a shower and I have to say I want to call this the miracle mirror. It never did fog up AND the mirror magnifies making it nice to use tweezers and wash my face.   1192. My husband and I have tried countless shower mirrors over the last ten years -- he uses one for shaving, I use one for eyebrow plucking and shaping. We must have dropped two hundred dollars, easily, on numerous mirrors, only to have each one immediately or eventually fog up during use. I finally decided to give the Fogless Shower Mirror a whirl, because one thing set it apart from the rest -- the built-in reservoir.<br /><br />And what do you know? It WORKS. We have had our Fogless Shower Mirror since August, and so long as we fill up the built-in reservoir with warm water, there is no clouding or fogging to speak of. The included squeegee is handy for removing water droplets as well.<br /><br />If you want a Fogless Shower Mirror that actually *delivers* on its promise not to fog, this is a product I would definitely recommend!<br /><br />(And as an added bonus, the mirror comes with two types of adhesive -- the standard adhesive foam pads *and* silicone adhesive, and together they have our mirror staying right where we put it!)
  1193. 3+ months of shaving and still no fog.
  1194. Great! No fog, and easy set up! My husband had a different one before this and it would fog, but this one is crystal clear!
  1195. Works exactly as it should. Thank you
  1196. My wife got this for me on my birthday back in March and I've been using it daily ever since. This is something any man cannot be without if shaving is a daily chore. I use it while in the shower and can be mounted to the wall with the provided tube of silicone. Some people say that the silicone won't slick to the wall, not a problem for me! Just make sure the area you're using is completely dry and use the entire tube. I fill the reservoir with hot hot water and there are no signs of leakage and its been 5 months of daily use. This is a very well made product that every man needs! It's a great gift any guy will enjoy for a long time. So guys, tell your woman to get one for you and you be disappointed!

It is very disappointing, because it worked well and never fogged. It just didn't last.

  1214. The first mirror that I have bought that actually works!!!
  1215. It really does work - the mirror doesn't fog. However, you must add hot water to it each time you shower, which my husband thought would be a nuisance at first. Now, he doesn't mind since it works so well.
  1216. I have bought and tried about 20 anti-fog shower mirrors in my lifetime. This one is the best. If you follow the directions, it stays up on the tile shower wall. The reflective surface remaims fog free and doesn't fade. A+
  1217. This item performs exactly as advertised: no fog. The only drawback was that I did not want to stick it to my shower tile by using the silicone adhesive. As far as I know, nothing will completely remove silicone residue should you want to remove the mirror for some reason; especially on rough ceramic tile. I overcame this by purchasing a 1/8&#34; thick, 10x12&#34; piece of Lexan (plexiglass) from Home Depot (Lowes also has it), and a small coat rack hook with two hooks and double screw holes in the shank. I mounted the coat hook to the top of the Lexan upside down by marking the hole placement and drilling two1/8&#34; holes. Used two small bolts with flat nuts to secure it in place. I hung this over the top my shower door, placed the mirror against the Lexan, and marked the top and bottom position to the height of my face. A black Sharpie marker works well. All you have to do then is lay the Lexan on a flat surface and mount the mirror to it per instructions. Since Lexan is a smooth surface product, you will have to rough it up a little with sandpaper where you are going to apply the silicone or it will not stick well. Now, when I want to shave, I just hook the assembly over my shower door and go to work. Filling the water holder is a snap by just holding it under the shower stream. When not in use, I keep it hung from by shower caddy. If anyone is really interested in this technique, I will post a photo on this review.
  1218. For the last 15-20 years,I have used a fogless mirror that connects to the water outlet and shower head to mirror. After twice trying to repair and having product replaced I gave up and thought this product sounded like a good alternative. After using for about a week, I am very pleased with the Fogless Shower Mirror by ToiletTree. Bought my second mirror for my second house. Installation has improved greatly with water resistant double-sided tape instead of silicone sealant. However instructions could suggest experimenting with location before final install because that double-sided tape is very close to permanent install and very difficult to relocate if you don't like the first location.
  1219. This mirror is acceptable at best. I previously had a 2-sided(1X-3X) mirror that I really liked, but I am unable to purchase it after having to replace the original mirror after 8+ years of use! Pain-in-the-butt to have to fill & empty it each use & would prefer to have a 3X or 5X mirror, rather than 1X!
  1220. EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED

  1222. My husband says that it's the best shower mirror on the market!
  1223. I purchased this for an ex boyfriend a few years ago and he loved this mirror!! He used it everyday to shave in the shower. It somehow got broke when he moved and he was pretty bummed he wasn't able to use it anymore. He talked about how awesome the fogless mirror was all the time!
  1224. My husband loves this mirror. It stuck great to our shower tile that isn't smooth, unlike suction cups. I'd recommend it.
  1225. The biggest surprise to me about this mirror was how it works. To keep it fogless, you fill the back of it with hot shower water, and it keeps the temperature difference between the mirror and the shower air at a minimum. It's simple but ingenious, and it works perfectly. No fog.<br /><br />I recommend you follow the instructions carefully. There is some important information in them.<br /><br />Pros:<br />* Lots of nice little touches. The mirror angle can adjust to one of several pre-set angles, up and down. The mounting is solid as a rock once you get it up (at least, so far). The tray included for your razor is a nice touch, and works well. Comes with a little squeegee for the mirror, which conveniently slides into storage under the razor tray.<br />* Stays perfectly fogless. What more can I say?<br />* Mirror, while not being an actual glass mirror, works very well.<br />* Instructions were very clear and simple to follow. While it takes several steps, installation is very easy.<br />* Great price.<br /><br />Cons:<br />* Squeegee could use a little work. It's tricky to wipe the mirror of water perfectly after you're done, because there's not really a good place to grip it. I wish ToiletTree would place a handle on the squeegee. That would help a lot.<br />* You must wait one day for the silicon adhesive to set. It's not a HUGE deal, but it would have been nice to be able to use it right after installation. Maybe they could experiment with just using 3M water-resistant Command adhesive strips, instead of the current silicon way, and see if that would work as well.<br />* The mirror picture bends EVER so slightly. It's not anything that actually matters much. It's just a slight cosmetic annoyance.<br /><br />Overall, though, an excellent mirror for the money. I'm very satisfied.
  1226. I bought this for my fiance and it is a good size. It also stays fog-less! However, because you have to use double sided tape to attach it in the shower, my fiance opted not to put it in the shower as to not risk leaving any marks on a rented apartment. So, while it does help, it limits what you can do with it.
  1227. It's a simple idea: there's a reservoir behind the mirror that you simply fill with warm shower water and that completely prevents the mirror from fogging. I have bought several of these for different bathrooms in my house and they all work flawlessly. Highly recommended.

  1230. Works as well as I could imagine. I'm pretty optimistic that it won't get worse over time (like many fogless mirrors) because it's using hot water instead of an anti-fog film. A brilliant use of basic science.<br /><br />The squeegee also works great, better than I hoped.

Then I return it to the holder and use the squeegee to clean the mirror. It is then perfect for shaving.

  1241. This was purchased so I can hopefully save time by shaving in the shower instead of at the sink. Installation instructions were simple and clear, and it took less than 3 minutes to have it installed in the shower. Follow the instructions and it will work as advertised. Very solid purchase!
  1242. My husband is addicted to shaving in the shower after a decade with a water-circulation fog-free mirror, so we had to look for a replacement when it started leaking last month. We found, though, that anything in the same style (i.e. - connected to the water source) was now made in plastic, and seemed not well made. So we decided to purchase this item based on the many positive reviews, and we're not at all disappointed. As a matter of fact, we love this one more, since he no longer has to face into the shower spray to shave - we placed this mirror in a more comfortable location away from the spray. For those unclear on the operation, you secure the mounting to the wall of your shower (with a combination of provided silicon gel and sticky tapes), and the mirror slides in and out of the base. The back of the mirror is designed to be a water reservoir, which you fill with hot water at the beginning of your shower (or at whatever time in your shower you are ready to use the mirror). It stays perfectly fog-free and the included squeegee is a brilliant idea, since it lets you clear off not only the water that splashes when you fill the reservoir, but any other water that lands on the mirror during your shower. The product is wonderful - secure on the wall and easy to use with wet hands. (My husband is also enjoying the shelf for his razor). I'm considering buying a second one for our guest bathroom. The only problem we've had is that it takes 24 hours for the silicon gel to dry when you mount the base to the wall of your shower - since my husband and I shower at different times of the day, we had to rearrange our shower schedule for one day to make sure we had the necessary 24 hours. But it was completely worth the wait :D
  1243. I have never had a fog-free shower mirror that actually worked well until I bought this one. Since all of my shower walls are glass tiles in a horizontal mosaic pattern, suction cups won't work, this mirror was easy to hang securely using the silicone included with it. It only takes a few seconds to fill up the water reservoir, and the mirror doesn't fog at all for the duration of the shower. Plus, it looks pretty good in there too.
  1244. This mirror had great reviews so I purchased it. We rely on these reviews because they are usually so accurate and give us great feedback on making a product decision. In this case, however, it failed us. The reviews were great for this mirror so I purchased with confidence. The mirror and structure is made with very thin lightweight plastic. it installed no problem. The problem came on first use. When you fill the reservoir with the warm water from the shower, the thin mirror warps outward and when you look in the mirror, your face is distorted. Dump the water out and your face looks normal again. Imagine putting water in a baggie how it bulges outward, well it isn't that bad but it's definitely noticable. You can put your finger on the mirror and push it back and watch your face distort like a carnival mirror. It's already afixed it to the wall so I won't return it. The mirror does stay fog clear and you can shave with it, I'd just expect the mirror to be able to withstand 6 inches of water behind it without distorting.
  1245. The brand name is a poor pun - Toilet Tree / toiletry - [sigh] - but everything else about this mirror is great.   1254. I found this product to work as advertised. Absolutely no fog. However, the squeegee is not enough to take off all the water on the face of the mirror. I like others have hard water out of my tap. Should I leave any water marks on the face of the mirror, calcium buildup will occur. This is simply the nature of hard water, not the fault of the mirror. I have learned to squeegee the mirror and then to wipe all water from the face of the mirror and bezel to insure no water spots. Further, no warpage of the image!

  1303. I gave this mirror four stars because it is truly fogless, with a simple design and construction that strikes a nice balance between convenience and appearance.<br /> The mirror stays clear at least 45 minutes after adding hot water, and the reflective surface doesn't look distorted or cheap to me. Installation is easy: Clean surface, apply adhesive, and mount it.<br /> I wish the mirror had a little magnification, but that's not necessarily a feature everyone would want. If your shower is not well lit, you may want to consider the lighted version of this mirror. Hanging the mirror after filling it with water can be a little hit-or-miss, but you get better at it with practice. Tip: Rest the mirror against the wall-mount, just below the slot, and push the mirror upward against the wall-mount until it falls into the slot. (For me, this method almost always results in success on the first attempt.)<br /> Since I installed the mirror on the shower wall opposite of where the shower head is located, the mirror never really gets wet. As a result, I don't use the squeegee that came with the mirror.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Mirror stays fogless as long as you need it to (you can always add more warm or hot water)<br />- No obvious distortion visible in mirror surface<br />- Installation was simple and fairly quick<br /><br />Cons:<br />- No magnification<br />- No light (ToiletTree offers a more expensive model with a light)<br />- Mount point is not visible when hanging mirror<br /><br /> I would recommend this mirror for anyone who's looking for a fogless shower mirror that really works, and who doesn't mind it's inexpensive plastic appearance.

  1313. I have owned this product for more than one year. I want to respond to the few negative reviews I have read about it: First - at least for the way mine was built when I bought it - It is true that the silicone paste supplied is inadequate, and mine fell off the shower wall the first day I put it up too. A quick trip to Home Depot for a large replacement tube solved that problem permanently. Second - It would indeed be nice if the tray for storing things had a ridge to keep things like one's razor from falling off occasionally. All else is good: The mirror has not gotten foggy to this day. It remains as clear as it was on the first day. The guy who claimed that the squeegee scratched the mirror must have slipped in a razor blade - mine remains perfect. The guy who said he could not properly manage the squeegee because of his &#34;man hands&#34; should check whether his fingers curl and his thumb is prehensile. The few people who said that the plastic spokes to tilt the mirror position gave way in a few months and the mirror then just hung down: Have you been clicking it into different positions all the time? Most people would just pick their mirror position and then leave it there. The thing is made of plastic for gosh sakes (although it is quite hardy). Mine still stays in place like a rock. I have never written a product review before, but this just kept nagging at me. Hope it helps.
