  1328. This is a great product. #1- I was a little skeptical at first. No screws? It will never work! I was wrong! I cleaned the tiles off as directed, applied the silicone adhesive and double sided tape (then ran downstairs real quick to get my level!). Stuck the mirror to the tile and waited 24 hours. Done, not coming off anytime soon! #2- Next, wasn't so sure about the whole water behind the mirror trick but after a few uses, it works GREAT!! You have to take the mirror off before each use and fill it with the same temperature water you are showering with which keeps it from fogging up. Trust me, it works like a champ. The mirror just slips on and off from its base no problem, nice design. Squeegee was a nice touch. #3- Finally, the mirror does swivel up and down which concerns me. This seems to be the flimsiest part of the mirror. I put mine at a level that my wife and I can both use so we will not be moving it up or down at all. I've been shaving for 30 years and this is the best shower mirror I have ever had because of the water behind the mirror trick.

  1366. Over the years I have owned many fogless mirrors. This one has them all beat hands down. I have only had it a few weeks but I can already tell it is a great product. The trick with this one is the tank on the back of the mirror that you fill with hot water; this keeps the temperature of the mirror the same as your shower thus eliminating the fog or steam that clouds other mirrors. Once I intentionally did not fill up the tank with water to see what would happen. The mirror did eventually fog but once I filled the tank with hot water and wiped the mirror with the provided squeegee, it was clear and stayed clear for the remainder of the shower. It also has a built in shelf which is handy for your razor. I also left the water in the tank once so that it would be cold when I used it again, and while it did eventually fog up, once again I filled it with hot water and it cleared up. I recommend this product. If, over the next few months, I discover an issue with this product I will write about that as well. If you don't see a follow up to this, there has not been a problem.

To keep the mirror fogless, you just have to remove the mirror off the bracket and fill the back container up with hot water. Itfs because of the hot water in the back of the mirror that the front of the mirror keeps from fogging. And it works and it realy is super easy to use. The mirror itself is adjustable, so once you mount it securely to wall, you can move it to accomodate anyone at any height, which is important to someone like me who is a mere 5f2 (my hubby is 6).   1382. This product works well. It is 100% fog-free and is easy to install. The squeegee works pretty well but does miss some droplets here and there - no big deal. The built-in shelf is a nice bonus!<br /><br />It is slightly annoying to have to fill it with water every time you use it but it really only takes a few seconds to fill it up - so no point in complaining really.<br /><br />Tips:<br />1) Empty it when you're done! If you leave water in it overnight it will get cold and when you re-fill it the mirror will warp. Emptying it after each use fixes this issue.<br />2) Think before you install it. I did, but not well enough. I installed it to the right of the shower caddy that hangs from the spout. But i installed it too close so the edge of the mirror just barely touches the caddy. Also I have to life the caddy out of the way in order to remove the squeegee - MY FAULT. Just think before you actually install it.
  1383. I've been using this fogless mirror for a few weeks now - here's my quick & dirty review: The installation is simple and takes about 3 minutes (then you let it set for ~12 hours). The mirror itself works great as long as you keep the reservoir filled with warm-hot water. The stand itself let's you angle the mirror up/down which is great in case my wife wants to use it - she can tilt it down. Not much left to comment on. All in all a great product - especially at the price.
  1384. This is the first review I have ever bothered to write because I am so happy with the product. I still expect it to fog up because of bad experiences with other mirrors but it hasn't failed me after many months. I highly recommend it to everyone like me that is frustrated with buying expensive mirrors that claim to be fog-free but are not. I looked at the reviews prior to purchasing it and all the positive reviews are dead on while all of the negative reviews are not. it is not true that the squeegee supplied will scratch the mirror or that is is like a fun house mirror.   1398. I do all my facial grooming in the shower, so after years of wasting time with cheap crap &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors that were anything but, I decided to pony up for the real deal. The design of this mirror is elegant in its simplicity: when you use water to make the mirror as hot as or hotter than the shower water, it's physically impossible for it to fog. Being a person who enjoys seeing simple concepts spun into useful, reliable products, I was sold.<br /><br />Glad to say, this product works as advertised. You wait for the water to get hot, slide the mirror up off the mount, fill up the reservoir, then slip it back into place... the whole process takes about 10 seconds. I like to set the faucet to full hot when filling the mirror, this way the water's sure to keep the mirror warm no matter how long I'm in the shower. Afterwards, spend another 5 seconds dumping the water from the reservoir and you're good to go. The included squeegee is a nice touch, so far it's the only thing I've ever needed to clean this mirror off.<br /><br />As for negatives, this mirror's expensive for what it is and what it's made out of, but you're paying more for the innovation than the materials. The installation also takes more work than most &#34;stick it on the wall&#34; shower mirrors, but I guess you need extra support since the water is heavy. Plastic construction means there will always be slight distortion of the reflection, but nothing to write home about. None of these cons were significant enough to knock a star off the rating.<br /><br />If you're the kind of person who prefers to &#34;manscape&#34; in the shower, this thing's a must-have. Not much else needs to be said.

  1503. Where has this been all my life?!?! I have been bearded for the better part of my adult life. The biggest challenge to trimming ones own beard is getting the undersides even on each side. It is like trying to trim your own sideburns (if you have those.) They never seem to come out exactly the same.<br /><br />My hair cutter explained to me that this is due to a retinal/perception issue we all have. I was forever trimming one side of my beard (unintentionally) to be narrower than the other.<br /><br />The installation is simple - but requires some patience. The silicon adhesive takes a full 24 hours to set in the shower. After that, all that is required is filling the removable mirror piece with hot/warm water - this prevents the fogging up.. then, remembering to empty it! The included squeegee actually works perfectly and is held in a slot built into the mirror base -You COULD lose it, but it would be hard!<br /><br />The problem is now solved.<br /><br />With this Fogless Shower Mirror from Toilet Tree Products, my beard is even. I trim it as I shave my neck in the shower. The mirror is ALWAYS clear and I can get within inches of it. I can actually see where I have been missing the mark and am missing it no longer.<br /><br />This is a bearded man's dream come true!<br /><br />UPDATE: June 20178<br /><br />After consistent reliable performance, I bought a second one for another shower stall. They just don't make things any better than this!

  1524. We have gone through many mirrors, trying to find one that truly didn't fog during my husband's shaves. This fits the bill! It is easy to install, easy to fill up the reservoir with water (this is why it doesn't fog), easy to pivot to the angle you need, and has a handy shelf for a razor. So, why didn't I give it four stars? Two reasons:<br /><br />1) The price. It's hard to justify spending more than fifteen bucks on a shower mirror, but like other products, if it actually works, it's worth it.<br />2) The downside to this being so secure is that it is also very hard to move. We recently PCS'd and found it very hard to remove the residual adhesive from the shower wall. We haven't put it up in our new apartment, but I believe I read in another review that we can use silicone or another type of adhesive to reattach it.<br /><br />Overall, I'd recommend it, simply because it works.

Original Review The mirror was great for the first year. It works as claimed. Add water and it does not fog. The issue is that if you are like most people you will leave the water in there when you are done. Add more water at the next shower etc. Having water sitting in the mirror eats the coating off the interior of the mirror. I do not have hard water so I was surprised that this happened. At first a line formed near the fill line and now the reflective coating is coming off in places resulting in a blurry and useless mirror. The only fix would be a new mirror. Good idea but poor quality on the mirror.

  1540. I don't always leave product reviews, but given that I have had many shower mirrors over the years that have been garbage I felt it was important I write this one. I have had several standard coated mirrors over the years (the type available at stores like Bed Bath & Beyond). However, the coating tends to wear out quickly eliminating the fog-free functionality.<br /><br />The concept of having hot water behind the mirror is really the only way to effectively create a truly fog-free mirror. I had purchased another, cheaper one in the past, which worked OK but found that the suction cup wouldn't stick to the shower wall for very long.<br /><br />In contrast, the backing for this mirror adheres to the shower wall with a combination of double sided tape and removable silicone (which you do need to let dry for 12 hours). I have only had this for 1 week, but so far so good. It sticks to the wall, stays fog free, and includes a built-in squeegee to wipe water droplets away (which is better than running under the shower stream). Overall, I would recommend this product to anyone over any other shower mirror on the market. Don't waste money on cheaper alternatives.
  1541. I want two things from this product. One is that is doesn't fog. Other is that it stays on the wall. (i.e. doesn't fall off after time and or with the slightest jostle). You get both of these plus a nice unexpected third feature. Simple but brilliant design does the trick. First is silicone gel that comes with it. Use that to get good purchase on tiles. I have had it for almost a year. Still on the shower wall. No sign of coming off. The second is the simple reservoir that you fill with hot shower water. This makes the mirror the same temperature as the shower environment so no fogging. Now the finishing touch. When ready to shave, you use the perfectly designed built squeegee to clean off the mirror. Perfect.

We did have a tube of adhesive, but it was all dried up. Luckily, we had similar adhesive on hand that could be used instead. I'm sure had we contacted the company, a replacement tube would have been sent to us. But by using our own, we didn't have to wait to use the product that we had purchased. So, shout out to ToiletTree....check your packages & make sure your adhesive is usable!!

  1579. I've been looking around for a good shower mirror for several months. I've been shaving in the shower for many years without a mirror because like some of the other reviews mentioned they wouldn't stay on the wall with the suction cups. This one has a bracket which attaches to the wall with provided silicone adhesive. The mirror along with a resevoir for warm shower water slides into the bracket. The mirror stays fog free and comes with a squeegee to clear the water droplets. This would be a good gift for anyone who shaves in the shower.
  1580. The mirror does what it claims to do. I do believe the mirror is a good purchase and does save time. Would I purchase the mirror again? Yes! In my opinion, the pros far outweigh the cons. The pros and cons below are just the facts from my viewpoint! Pros: The mirror does not fog up. If the directions are followed, the mirror will not fall. Squeegee works well. Excellent customer service with the company in case you have any problems. They make every effort to make you happy. May save time when shaving as compared to shaving in front of the sink after a shower. Cons: Once the back of the mirror is filled with water, it could be a little difficult to line up the slot to put the mirror back on the holder. (An option might be to keep a cup in the shower and fill the mirror while it is still hanging) Placement of the mirror may be a challenge. I have placed the mirror in two locations and it still gets water on it while I shave. Size of the mirror is small (if you only shave your face it is fine; but for those who shave your head it could be a little larger). Price. Compared to other mirrors, this one costs more. I have not used other mirrors so I have no comparison of the quality of the other mirrors.

  1588. Okay perhaps a bit of an editorial, but hey this is my review! I was always annoyed when I got out of the shower only to find that the mirror in the bathroom was foggy from the nice shower I just had. Sure, I could wipe off the mirror, but within moments it would refog -- perhaps my wife was now taking a shower and reducing my humility while adding some more humidity to the situation, or perhaps my shower was just so hot that there was still some left over steam that was making its way to the mirror. Nevertheless I would get my little sliver of the mirror prepared for the expedition into the land of shaving only to find that the razor was missing, of course in the shower because my wife decided she wanted to borrow it for her legs.<br /><br />This fantastic mirror, now mounted in the shower, has an excellent ledge that has become the perminant home of my razor, it never gets foggy (because the mirror is the same temperature as the water vapor so there is no condensation on that surface). If you are thinking, hey let me get one of those cheaper mirrors that sticks in my shower, don't. This one is the way to go, it really is as good as they say!   1599. If you currently rent and can not use double sided tape to hang anything, this product may not be right for you. I gave it **see below** stars because it LOOKS like it will be a good product if you're able to use double sided tape that we all know is very difficult to remove. It does use removable silicone adhesive to secure the mirror to the wall as advertised, but it uses double sided tape to hold the mirror in place while the silicone gel sets. This should have been acknowledged in the product description. The mirror is well packaged and looks like it will work well as long as you remember that you'll have to empty the reservoir and re-fill it with hot water every time you use it. It has a bunch of small holes along the top side and my first thought was that it will take some time to get the dispersed shower spray to eventually fill the reservoir through those holes. If you don't mind using double sided tape, then try the product... it might work well. If you don't like or can't use double sided tape, then try another product. Good luck! UPDATE: I still ended up returning this product, so I can't provide any actual usage feedback. The double-sided tape is still a concern given my rental situation. What I can tell you is that the manufacturers of this mirror really stand behind it. I had received an email from Director of Marketing as a normal follow up to my purchase. Since I had just published my review, I responded to let them know my concerns about the tape. I received several email responses from the President directly letting me know the tape has been well tested and would come off easily, and also suggesting another way I could secure the mirror. He also promised to update the listing to be more clear about the use of tape. I initially gave this product 2 stars... because it wouldn't work for me and the description didn't make that clear up front. I've upped it to 4 stars. I can't tell you if it really works. I've left the title of the review the same: potential customers should know it needs tape for the mounting process. But if every manufacturer showed the same care and concern for both its products and its customers we'd all be much happier. This product may not work for my situation, but I won't hesitate to try any of their other products that do.

  1615. I received my mirror as a gift about two years ago. The mirror has survived two moves in that time. Recently, one side of the bracket broke (the piece that the mirror slides into). The break was not a manufacturing defect, but rather the result of a frantic grasp to prevent a fall in the shower. Without a hiccup, the manufacturer offered to send me a new bracket (as well as new wall mounting silicone and adhesives) free of charge. I was floored by such great service.   1616. I've had this mirror for three days now, and I'm thrilled that it works as advertised. The \\"fogless\\" mechanism is pretty clever: The mirror has a reservoir in the back of it that holds warm water from your shower, which equalizes the temperature on both sides and prevents condensation from forming. The mirror itself easily slides on and off the mounting bracket, so it just takes a second to fill up the back with hot water and slide it back onto the bracket. No chemicals, oils or special coatings needed!<br /><br />I read another review that complained about it not adhering to the wall. Although it's only been a few days so far, it seems to be holding very tightly. The mirror comes with a tube of removable epoxy and provides clear instructions on how to adhere it to the wall. It seems pretty foolproof as long as you follow the instructions and let it sit overnight so that the adhesive can set. I haven't yanked hard on it, but it seems to me mounted tightly enough on the tile wall of my shower that it would take some extensive prying and pulling to get it off.
  1617. I decided to start shaving in the shower (softer beard, closer shave, easier to rinse...). To do this, I was going to need an anti-fog shower mirror. One that REALLY works. This mirror does the job perfectly!<br /><br />Before turning on the shower, I run the sink faucet until it's warm to hot. I then take the mirror off it's mount, fill the reservoir behind the mirror, and then place it back onto the mount. Throughout the entire shower, the mirror stays perfectly clear and fog-free! I can easily shave in the shower now.<br /><br />This is an excellent fogless shower mirror that works great every time!

  1648. I decided to start shaving in the shower to save time and hopefully get an easier, smoother shave from the hot water. The only problem is obviously finding a mirror that doesn't fog. After searching around a bit, I found this one and another smaller mirror on amazon both with nearly 5 stars. Both of them seemed like good mirrors and I like the fact that they are based on science rather than some magical pixy dust that gets rid of fog. The idea is that if you keep both sides of the mirror the same temperature, it won't fog. The other mirror required that you run it under the hot water to remove the fog. I was a little worried about how long it would last, and liked the idea of \\"filling\\" up this mirror to hopefully keep it fog free for longer. This one also includes a nice little shelf, a squeege, and silicon for attaching to wall.<br /><br />Pros:<br />+Attaches to wall with silicon (no suction cups!) - no worries it will fall off in the middle of the night<br />+Lots of extras - little shelf, squeege, etc<br />+Great instructions and simple setup<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Rather expensive as compared with other mirrors, but I figured if I use it everyday might as well get a nice one<br /><br />Great product, highly recommended if shaving in the shower is your thing (which it should be!) Will update review if necessary.
  1649. This mirror worked great for 4 months. It definitely does not fog when you fill it with hot water. Unfortunately, over (a short period of) time, the notches to hold the mirror in position wear. When you hang the mirror you can adjust how much it's tilted towards or away from you. It only took six months for the notches to wear so much, that when the mirror is now filled completely with hot water, it cannot stay in position and falls forward because it's too heavy for the worn notches. Since the fourth month (it's now the 8th) we have had to add less and less water to the mirror so the mirror was less and less heavy, so it would stay in position. With less water, the mirror isn't completely fogless. In just six months it has gotten to the point where the mirror will not stay in any position at all anymore, no matter how little water / how light, so it completely bends forward and shows you your feet and not your face. I have resorted to \\"wedging\\" our tub stopper behind the mirror and against the wall, so it won't fall forward and keep it's position. It's a flimsy solution but it works ok.<br /><br />UPDATE 10/24/2012:<br /><br />The president of the company saw my review and contacted me and sent me a new piece which resolves this issue. It was really easy to snap off the old piece and snap on the new one. Now the mirror works perfectly again. He said they were aware of this issue and that the pieces are manufactured differently now which avoid this problem. I am very impressed with this company and highly recommend them.
  1650. Simply fill the mirror with warm/hot shower water and voila, no fog. What a simple solution to a fog-free shower mirror. Why can't I think of things like this? :)) Very easy to install. I used 3M Command Water-Resistant strips to install on a glass shower wall rather than the semi-permanentt glue that comes in the box. The mirror is just the right size and works as advertised.

  1759. I bought this based on other Amazon users' recommendations. It was easy to put together and apply. I will let you know if there are any problems in the future. Remember, no news is good news! January 5, 2012 January 17th, 2012 I am still extremely pleased with the performance of this shower mirror. It slides off the well constructed plastic frame easily so you can fill the back of the mirror with hot or even warm water, which prevents it from fogging up. Then you slide it back on the frame, lather up and shave. The opening at the top of the mirror where the water goes in is wide enough to hold your razor as well when not in use. There is also a platform under the mirror that you could lay your razor upon, and beneath the platform is a place to hold the squeegee that you can also easily slide the squeegee in and out of without problem. The squeegee is the exact width of the mirror, so one downward wipe does the job. The mirror repels the water so it only beads up on it. I never need to squeegee it while shaving, I only do it after I am done shaving. No water spot stains on the mirror after over a week of usage. The mirror frame is held onto the shower wall via adhesive which is included along with the double stick tape, and the back of the frame is clearly marked so you see exactly where to apply both the mounting tape and the adhesive. It takes twelve hours before the frame is secured and adhesive set before you can put the mirror up on the frame. Let it dry for the twelve hour period it requires and then slide the mirror on to the frame, and you are all set. I really like it. I had a suction cup mounted fog-less mirror that fell down nearly daily with an alarming crash before buying this one. It also fogged up. I hated having my razor and razorblades chip from falling down with the dang thing. That is no longer a worry. I am very pleased thus far. I will update this should there be any problem in the future.
  1760. Love it! Product arrived perfectly intact and on time. Glued to the wall perfectly and has since been used everyday. It's exactly what I needed in the shower so that my shave could be precise.

Mine have been durable. Highly recommended.
  1763. I've had other &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors that used a coating for the foglessness, but which quickly over time lost the ability to remain so. I wasn't willing to get one of the fancy ones that connect directly to the showerhead with a water connection. This is a good, simple, and efficient compromise that merely requires you fill the reservoir behind the mirror when needed. It works perfectly and solves the fogging issue correctly. It can be demonstrated by filling the reservoir half way and noting the bottom half of the mirror remaining clear while the top half fogs.<br /><br />The main concern is how it is mounted. It came with a measly two sticky pads that looked wholly inadequate on their own so likely are to assist in the mounting with the included adhesive. This makes the mirror quasi-permenant and means I can't easily switch it between my bathrooms. I can live with that for now. But I do have concerns how cleanly it can be unmounted when the time comes; which includes how well the back of the base is preserved in the process for remounting somewhere else. On the other hand, given the added water weight, I doubt that suction cup mounts would be sufficient and I've had issues with them in the past.<br /><br />Other points and my opinion:<br />* It's rather big, probably bigger than it needs to be (positive).<br />* It has a shelf for the razor (positive) but I wish it had a little something to keep it from slipping or moving like some bumps, a border or even some kind of rubberized coating (negative).<br />* it has a squeegee and a place to store it (very positive)<br />* the plastic materials do feel kind of cheap though, especially for something that needs to be mounted quasi-permenantly (negative). I can imagine an accident where the shelf breaks off and I am concerned when it comes time to unmount the base if it might break in the process of ripping it from the wall.<br /><br />So I like it a lot because it works better than any shower mirror I'vehad before, and my only real &#34;concern&#34; is when it comes time to remove it cleanly and then re-attach it somewhere else.
  1764. I bought this shower mirror for my boyfriend to get him to shave more often - and it worked! He loves being able to shave in the shower, not in front of my sink, and I love not having to clean the disgusting sink! It looks exactly as nice as the image shown and doesn't look bulky or take up too much room in my small shower space. Keep in mind though, that it takes 12 hours for the silicone adhesive to dry onto the shower surface, and the silicone should not be applied in a steamy bathroom or onto a wet surface.
  1765. When we first got this I don't know who wanted it more me or my hubby. So, we took it out of the box and came to realize something that we really liked. NO suction cups that is really nice because it seems like every-time you use something that has suction cups it just falls off. With this product you actually use adhesive which works so much better and lasts. We did let it stand for a full 24 hours before putting the mirror on it and using it. Another great thing is the ease of putting and taking the mirror off. It just slides off very easy.   1766. Mirror shipped quickly and was exactly as advertised. Great product and I would absolutely buy it again. The silicone adhesion system is 100 times better than the suction cups which are prone to falling off.

  1768. The mirror arrived on time, in great shape, is exactly as described. We even got a follow up e-mail with care instructions. Very happy with the seller and the mirror, we have not mounted it to the wall yet, but not at all worried about it.
  1769. I had been looking for a replacement for my long lasting shower mirror that finally just gave out after many happy years of service. It was the white plastic one that you screwed on to the pipe and then put your shower head back on. For my money that is by far the best one out there. With that said, I wanted to get a nicer looking mirror so I decided to order this ToiletTree product. The fact that it actually works great was the reason I gave it 4 stars. A perfect product . . . it is not. Don't get me wrong. It works fine. It's the process that comes along with the item that had me leave out one star. The object of the mirror is to place it somewhere out of the way of water fall on one of your shower walls. You'll need to glue it and use the tacky strips provided. When I went to do just that, I found that I had a decorative raised tile strip that was exactly at the level that I needed to mount the mirror. Ok, not the mirrors fault. Luckily, I have a ledge that the mirror sits on perfectly. If you are able to mount it on a wall, then when ready to shave, remove the mirror from the base, fill it with the hot water, place it back on the base and shave. More work than I deem necessary, but hey that's what I bought. If you can't mount it on a dry wall away from the shower head like me, here is what you can expect. I can't fill it all the way because then it becomes top heavy and will topple over. Lucky for me, the 1st time I used it, as it fell forward, I caught it. So, fill it about half full and you get most the mirror. I use the squeegee quite often because the water splashes on to the mirror. When finished, I just empty it out and it's ready for the next day. All in all, it works as it is supposed to. It doesn't fog up and I can get a good shave. Just be sure you know that you will have to remove the mirror, fill it each time, and then dump the water out. If you're ok with that, then it will be a 5 star product in your hands. Good luck!
  1770. It works as advertised. Just fill the small reservoir with hot water or water from the shower head and the mirror stays fog free.   1778. I've purchased several in-shower mirrors for shaving, and regardless of their fog-free fanfare, they either don't work at all, work for a short period of time, collect hard water deposits to the point it doesn't matter whether you have fog on the mirror (consisting of some reflective adhesive you can't clean) or not. My favorite was a contraption that was supposed to direct a stream of water to the mirror to keep fog off, but ended up spurting water everywhere but where it was supposed to go. In addition, the big, clunky fake mirror kept sagging from where I would put it via the goose-neck support.<br /><br />Anyway, I decided to try the ToiletTree, and have been very pleased. It takes a bit of time to let the adhesive dry, but no big deal. Just make sure you have the base mounted at the height you want, because once it's set, it ain't goin' nowhere. In fact, I'm on here ordering another one because I'm moving and can't bring my trusty #1 with me to the new place.<br /><br />After 2 years of use, I still have a clean mirror, thanks to the provided squeegee. Also, the reservoir works like a charm, allowing me fog free performance, regardless of how long I'm in the shower, or what the temp the water in the reservoir is.<br /><br />All in all, a great product, and while it may be a tad more than many other shower shaving gadgets, you'll never need to worry about buying another one....That is, until you move.

  1804. This shower mirror is truly fogless! It is the only one I've owned that really doesn't fog over in the shower. Rather than use a coating that wears out quickly or never works like other shower mirrors, this uses a hot water reservoir behind the mirror to keep condensation off. Just fill the reservoir with hot water when you get in the shower, and the mirror will be clean and usable the whole time. Just remember to pour the water out when you're through using, or it'll be full of cold water the next shower.<br />The only problem I had was the first mirror I bought (I have 2, for 2 showers) the silicone glue had hardened.   1820. Edit: Well, the company saw my review and immediately sent me a new pivot mechanism that apparently fixes the issue that I was having. So far, the mechanism seems much more rigid, and the issue seems to be solved. I'm going to rate this 4 stars for now, and update this in a few months when I can see how well the new pivot holds up to time. At the very least, the company has very good service and strives to make sure that their customers are satisfied.<br /><br />This mirror is awesome (at first).<br /><br />Things that work well: Anti-fog technology is great (if you fill the reservoir in the back with warm/hot water, your mirror will never fog). The fact that I can shave in the shower is awesome too (saves time, and shaving is way easier - I get way fewer cuts). The stickers that attach the mirror to your wall are great too - the fixture is still up after a year of use.<br /><br />Things that don't work well: The mechanical design is unreliable/faulty. The mechanism that allows you to adjust the angle of the mirror breaks down really easily. I mounted the mirror to be level with the height of my face (so that when the mirror is angled to be straight-ahead, I could see most of my face when shaving). The only time I ever adjusted it was when I needed to angle it one level down to see my neck. However, after only 3 months of use, the mirror started falling down to the very bottom rung/angle whenever I filled the mirror with water. The mechanism can't bear the weight of the water in the reservoir anymore. Eventually, I had to angle the mirror up one rung at a time, and all the rung angles wore out. After a whole year of use, the mirror only sits at the very top angle (so I have to stand on my tip toes to see my face), or the very bottom angle (where it falls down to most often, in which case I have to crouch to see my face). Since this mechanical design wears down so easily, the instruction booklet should tell people to mount it such that the mirror is above them, and they can see their face at the very bottom angle that the mirror can be mounted.
  1821. I've bought two of these and about to get my third; the adhesive isn't reusable so I need a new one whenever I move but that's my own problem so I'm still giving the product 5 stars.<br />Both of the ones I've had stuck like cement and never had any issues with them becoming unglued.<br />I start up my shower and immediately fill the reservoir with the shower-head and put it back in its base.   1826. I was a bit skeptical about this product, despite the high rating it has. I had tried a few fogless mirrors in the past, and all of them would work great for about a month (if even that), and then start fogging up no matter what.<br /><br />This mirror works in that you put warm water in a reservoir behind the mirror, which keeps the mirror from fogging during use. And, really, no fog appears.<br /><br />I have been using this mirror for almost a year, at this point, and can't say that I have any complaints. If the mirror has already fogged up before I add water, once I add water to the reservoir, the fog is gone. If I forget the water in the reservoir overnight, I just dump it out, refill it, and then it works just as it should.<br /><br />What's great, also, is that the mirror doesn't attach to your shower by way of a suction cup, but instead uses a silicone adhesive. This is especially great if your shower has textured walls or tiling, and I have always found that suction cups warp or wear over time. The silicone adhesive has not yet given any sign of failing, and holds to the shower wall just as well as the first day.<br /><br />The only complaint that I could have about this is that you are not able to easily move the mirror to a different spot, due to the silicone adhesive. While you are able to remove the adhesive from the wall with little trouble, you will need to apply new adhesive. But, I can't really complain about this too bad, as it is really easy to procure a silicone adhesive.<br /><br />The mirror also comes with a squeegee for the mirror, and recommends that you use this squeegee on the mirror after each use. I have often forgotten to wipe the mirror clean, but have had no issues with clarity after just rinsing the mirror under water and using the squeegee to clear the mirror of any droplets.<br /><br />Overall, after a year of use, I still consider this is to be a great product that works exactly as described.

  1837. The mirror is fantastic and works exactly as advertised. It will literally change your life. But such is life. I find it so indispensable that this is a secondary concern.
  1838. After reading all the reviews chose this one. Following the instructions exactly was easy to put up. allowed a little more than the 24 hours to set but has been up now for over a month. love the fogless feature. now I can see what I am doing when washing my face.
  1839. I have had this for almost a year and it is fantastic. The only issue I experienced is some faint water marks, which I suppose is natural for this kind of product. Otherwise it has remained clear. Would highly recommend.
  1840. Just got this mirror and it's great for shaving. I don't even need to fill it with hot water. I just splash a handful of water on it and... I'm good to go.
  1841. I got this for Christmas. Wife purchased it from amazon, knowing I would love something like this.<br />When I found out how much she paid I was a little annoyed. This item should be 10 bucks... 15 dollars MAX.<br /><br />I will not rate it 5 stars and call it \\"fantastic, amazing OMG, and perfect\\" like many of these reviewers. Maybe we are so let down by cheap chinese junk that when something decent comes around, people act like its great? Yes, it is a mirror that attaches to the wall. Its not perfect.<br /><br />Pros: Its a shower mirror. Thats basically what I was wanting.<br /><br />Cons: The adjustment bracket on my unit is extremely hard to use, and I do not feel confident that it will last a year. You have to use both hands and a surprising amount of force to position it at the desired angle. This takes a few attempts because the force required might actually adjust it too far, so you have to backtrack. The cracking sound it makes is frustrating because I keep thinking the dumb thing just broke.<br />Now the mirror... it distorts. You can shave if you get really close to the mirror and if you are dead center. If you sway a little bit, your image begins to morph and distort like a funhouse mirror. Yes its not extreme, but it is annoying. Before I got this mirror I used my wifes circular shaped mirror which is roughly the same size with no problems. I did have to rig it so that it was attached to the shower caddy I have hanging from the shower head, but it worked with no distortion.<br />I wont list its lightness and visibly cheapness as a con, because it should be engineered to be light in order to be positioned to a shower wall with the adhesive to avoid it from falling down.
  1842. I've had many of these shower mirrors over the years and this is by far my favorite. Anyone who uses them knows the frustration when the fog-free film on the cheaper mirrors wears off. You can buy spray to refresh them, but it's expensive and a constant pain. This mirror went up easily and is holding great to my fiberglass shower. I assume it would hold equally well to tile, but can't comment on that. It just takes a second to fill with hot shower water and you are good to go. The squeegee is a nice touch to give you a spotless mirror. I actually only use mine at the end of the shower after I dump the water -- just so it dries without water spots.
  1843. I have been using this product for about 2 months and am very pleased. I didn't know what to expect regarding installation..I assumed it would be a suction cup system. This unit is installed using a small tube of silicone adhesive and double sided tape. (all included in the box). The written instructions are very clear, and there are markings on the rear of the unit to guide you. Make sure the tile surface is clean (no soap film) and dry. It is suggested to use some alcohol to make sure the surface is dry. (alcohol not included). Use ALL of the silicone as instructed. I followed all instructions and am pleasantly surprised at how well attached the mirror is to the tile. The unit is definitely fog-less. To achieve this, there is a hollow space behind the mirror that must be filled with hot water when you use it. At first I thought this to be inconvenient, but it takes less than 10 seconds to lift the mirror from its bracket and hold it under the running stream of water from the shower. The included squeegee is also a nice touch and easy to use. With my old mirror, I had to use a spray cleaner before each shower to get the mirror usable...and the result was not very good. I highly recommend the ToiletTree fog-less mirror.
  1844. I got this for my hubby and this is probably our 4th shower mirror...This one is the BEST! By far the best we've ever had. Maybe our shower is big enough that it doesn't get foggy, but I don't even have to put water in the holder on the back. Very clear and the squeege works great.
  1845. I checked this and other &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors and ended up picking this one out. I have had numerous &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors and I like this one the best. Even though you have to fill it with warm water, this is process is very easy to accomplish and it does keep the mirror from fogging up. The squeegee works very well removing the water on the mirror. And the mirror itself is nice and big...better than other mirrors that are out there. I like this product so much that I am ordering another for our Beach House.
  1846. The mirror works great. You fill it each time with warm tap water and it remains clear. I highly recommend this product.
  1847. So I got this as a gift. Shaving in the shower (head & face) was all about the feel of the stubble and any missed spots. Only after getting out and looking in the mirror close up could I see where I missed. Now I don't have to wait. This product doesn't get fogged up once you load it with hot water from the shower (very easy). I found it the instructions simple to hang it initially. Would I have preferred not to glue it to my tile, yes, but i also realize that no suction cup would hold (I have one of those massive ones that they used to sell on TV - it still falls down every once & a while). For the price ($30 or so) it is worth it.

I think it could use less water and get the same good results. I feel quilty tossing all that water down the drain every day. So now I'm putting it in the cats bowl.

  1854. The item works like it was described. My son loves it, now he can shave in the shower. It does not fog up when there is not water in it.
  1855. The installation was easy, albeit you need to used the supplied glue and wait 24 hours for the glue to dry before using this mirror in the shower.<br /><br />It has great form and function. Only four stars because 1) I wish the tray underneath the mirror had a hole to hang razor, or was a little bigger. The mirror length squeegee supplied takes up most of the space on the tray/shelf. 2) The tilt mechanism is a bit jerky and I am concerned it may break if moved many times.<br /><br />Other than those minor things that have room for improvement I must say this is the best performing fog free shower mirror I have ever tried. Once I set the tilt so I can see my entire face for shaving I don't think I will be adjusting it again. Note that you do need to fill the mirror cavity with hot water while you are in the shower. That is what makes it fog free. You simply dump out the water when you are done with shaving then fill it up again the next time. I have tried mirrors in the past that hook up to the shower head or other water source, but they always eventually leaked or failed. This mirror seems like it will work for years with very minimal effort. Great simplistic design.
  1856. I've had a number of shower shaving mirrors over the years and this one may well have been the lowest price. Having said that, it works great and does not fog when you fill it with warm water, as per the instructions. It was easy to install, easy to use and the supplied squeegee works great, too. I highly recommend this product.
  1857. OK, the OCD in me tells you that you should seriously consider this product if you are in the market for shaving mirror. Although the cheaper ones will stay fogless (for a short while), this one stays fogless for a LONG time (up to 30 minutes). Takes the 'rush to shave' out of the way. Also, let's talk quality. This is a quality product. It comes with a squeegee ..... what OCD wouldn't LOVE that! Use it, and each time you get in the shower, NO water spots (from the previous shower) on the mirror. Buy this and you will say \\"yea, that was worth the money, and then some.\\" I NEVER write reviews. This is the FIRST product I have felt strongly enough to do so. What's that tell you? Buy it, and enjoy it!

  1862. I've purchased at least a half-dozen so-called fogless mirrors in the last decade, but this is the first that actually does not fog up while I'm in the shower.
  1863. the tilt stayed up.<br /><br />It does everything as promised and is surprisingly sturdy, A pretty awesome product that saves me from cleaning hair off my bathroom counter all the time, but after filling and emptying the water reservoir a few times it no longer holds a proper tilt.<br /><br />Make sure you put it up high because once you mount it once there is no going back.
  1864. The fogless feature of this product really does work perfectly. It's such an elogant solution to the problem of a fogging mirror. I use to have a portable fan blowing toward my old shower mirror, which not only didn't work well, it also made me very cold!<br /><br />This mirror doesn't fog even under the most intense steam, which is how I take my showers now when I intend to shave. The hot water and air really make for a much better shave with no razor burn.<br /><br />The only down side is that the installation does require you to use silcone adhesive (enclosed with product) on the back of the mirror mount and to prep the area to which you're going to attach the mirror mount. It takes about 15-20 minutes if you're really particular about getting nice even beads of silcone adhesive on the mirror mount and finding the right height/position for it's attachment on the shower wall. The benefit is that the mounting is secure- you don't have to worry about suction cups coming loose, like with other products. All said, it's welll worth the time and effort to go through this process.
  1865. Return purchaser. Have had the first one for several years and just bought a new one for a different location. Absolutely no negative issues. Holds water reservoir, always unfogged, no spotting on reflective mirror, no slippage from glass surface.
  1866. I bought two of these a few years back. Now we are moving and I need more for our new house. I've tried others but these are MUCH better.
  1867. I had seen similar products advertised over the years, long before I had the capacity to shave my face (namely when I was a little boy traveling by airplane with mom & dad). I always wondered how exactly a non-fogging mirror would function, especially whether a certain type of material was used to create the mirror or if a special substance had to be applied to the surface to prevent fog build-up. I decided to invest in this product because shaving outside the shower using just my bathroom mirror had become an annoyance. I reasoned it would be much more convenient to shave in the shower, and I proved myself correct. The mirror functions by use of a reservoir behind the mirror into which hot water is placed. The heat from the water prevents steam from accumulating on the mirror's surface. The mirror comes with a small scraper, to remove water droplets that will build-up on it. This is not a bother at all, as the water droplets easily come off. I highly suggest this product. The price is really great (much cheaper than what it was selling for 15 years ago in the SkyMall Magazine) and works very well. Application to the wall of your shower is very easy, and the directions are completely straight-forward. This product is great for its convenience, use, and value.
  1868. I have been a shower shaver for many years. This is the first \\"fogless\\" mirror that really works. It takes about a minute to mount it. Follow the instructions and let the glue dry and you're in business. This product works. I have been using it for a couple of weeks now and if you follow the simple instructions and fill it with water, takes about 5 seconds, it will not fog. Great product, glad I spent the extra couple of bucks for it. You get what you pay for and in this case I got my money's worth.
  1869. I shave my head. Daily. And for several years, about every couple months, I had to purchase another mirror at department stores because the &#34;fogless&#34; it claimed, would fog up. It's impossible to shave when you can't see yourself =). So I took to trusty Amazon to look for yet, another replacement. When i came across this mirror by ToiletTree, and saw that the reviews were 5 star with over 1000 ratings, I gave it a shot.<br /><br />I've been using this for a few months now and I'm completely satisfied by what it claims and how it works. I have yet to even see a &#34;start&#34; of a fog. It has done what it has promised and more.<br /><br />Besides not fogging up, the ability to tilt the mirror was just incredible and as an added bonus, the squeegee to start you off. (to get rid of water spots.. not fog).<br /><br />The ONLY thing I would recommend to make this product even better is an upside down guide on the back. The same guide that's used to support the mirror, have another upside down and off to the side. So when you drain out the water, you can store the mirror upside down to prevent any deposits.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this to anyone.
  1870. The product is well made and is designed to stay up on the shower wall (so far, so good!).That was the biggest problem with the previous suction cup version that I owned for several years (waking up suddendly in the nighttime when it crashed down, was not fun, and it earned me several bad looks for days from my spouse and dogs!). Its a clever design to use the hot water of the shower inside the mirror to keep the fog away (this works very well), but it's a slight hassle to fill up and replace every shower usage (but, like I said, it works!). The mirror assembly that is removable is very light which is also a good design feature. The only reason I did not rate this 5 stars is that the mirror should have been made more useful for close up viewing (it tends to be more of a wide angle lens, in fact). This is not ideal for shaving the face area. Overall, a great product though...

  1882. After reading so many great reviews about this mirror, I can't find anything else to add.<br /><br />The mechanics of this mirror are like this. It is a semi-permanent install. Your shower needs to have a surface that double sided tape and clear silicone can stick too. If it doesn't have that kind of surface you will need to prep the surface by lightly scuffing the surface with sandpaper, emory board or other appropriate abrasive.<br /><br />The double sided tape does the immediate bond to hold the mirror in place, the silicone makes the long lasting bond. I was able to pull this off the tile at my old place reapply some new double sided tape to the bracket and some fresh clear silicone and 24 hours later it was ready for service again.<br /><br />I love that thermodynamics are the deciding factor to the efficacy of this system as opposed to anti-fog agents which never last. Other oft mentioned and luauded features. Mini silicone squeegee for wiping splash off the mirror, the mini razor shelf and the 15 degrees of mirror tilt.<br /><br />All in all a great purchase for myself and a great gift idea for anyone who shaves in a bathroom either in or out of a steamy shower.
  1883. This shower mirror does what so many have not before it... It stays fog free during my ridiculously long showers. I only wish I had bought the one with the lights, as I tend to miss spots when they are illuminated.
  1884. Best Shower mirror ever. Works perfectly.

And, as long as you put hot water in the chamber behind the mirror, it truly stays unfogged--depending on the length of time you need to use the mirror per shower, you may need to reload it with hot water a second time because the water eventually cools.   1922. This product makes shaving so much easier. I always used to shave outside with hair cutters while i cut my hair (to get rid of the long facial hair) then shave the little rough specs off with a regular shaver over the sink to get a closer shave but I am always rough in the morning.<br /><br />Being able to shave in the shower while my pores are open allows for me to get the best shave I can get and I still have a smooth baby face the next day.<br /><br />This never gets foggy why i am in the shower when i fill it up with hot water. This is a lot nicer then having to spray some type of coating on.<br /><br />I would recommend you get the one that has a light on it over this one if you don't have a light right above your shower.
  1923. This mirror met my expectations. I do not have a problem with distortion as other reviewers mentioned. I like the fact that it is not glass, as dropping it and having it break on my shower floor is what I was trying to avoid. It was easy to install, and functions well.
  1924. The hot water reservoir is a great innovation and lasts longer than the other mirrors which lose their power over time. And the squegee is a nice touch. But the silicone just gave out and the thing crashed to the floor and broke. Darn.<br /><br />But you know what - I'm gonna buy another one, because it's better than the other brands.
  1925. The short version: Buy this mirror! (or the lighted version) You will not be disappointed!<br /><br />To put it simply, the mirror works. It remains fixed to the wall, is easily cleaned, and provides a fog free mirror for shaving during morning showers. I shave my head and facial hair every other day or so in the morning, and have been using this mirror for about a year. I've found it best to fill the mirror when I require it, and to empty it afterwards. I'm not always best at remembering to empty the reservoir which results in pouring out cold water onto my feet when I use the mirror next.<br /><br />I have two other notes to make:<br />1. The package arrived with a silicone adhesive tube which had partially dried. I attempted to hang the mirror construct with the remaining amount, but it fell the next day during its first use. I contacted the product manufacturer via email, and the president responded the same day! They sent a replacement adhesive tube and mount within days. Utilizing the full tube has kept the mount properly in place during my year of use. THANK YOU SO MUCH TOILETTREE, for an awesome product, and amazing customer service!<br />2. In hindsight I should have purchased the lighted model. The light in my shower is not bright, and while that makes for a cozy shower experience, lack of a bright light does not assist when attempting to shave. This is not at all a detraction from this product, but rather an encouragement that potential buyers should carefully consider lighting conditions when deciding between this version and the lighted version.
  1926. BeSt product to buy. It completely changed my shaving experience. I used to hate the days when I had to shave in front of the bathroom mirror after I got out of the shower. Now I can shave in the shower with my perfect for less mirror and don't mind shaving at all anymore. Very worth buying!
  1927. The Fogless Shower Mirror securely adheres to my shower wall and doesn't steam up. It saves me valuable time in the morning, plus I get a closer shave.

  1935. First, let me say that after more that 10yrs of struggling with shaving mirrors this has been one of the best products I've ever purchased, if only everything I bought served it's purpose so well. I used to buy shaving mirrors maybe once every 2-3 months or so and I've own this for around 3yrs I believe. The only minor critisim I would offer is that when the mirror is full of water, it no longer holds it's 90 degree position perpendicular to the wall and will fall to one of the other lower positions, perhaps to 135 Deg or so. Somehow the gears (for lack of a better word?) appear to have worn and no longer stays snapped in place? This is the only reason I would give it 4 instead of 5 stars, otherwise everything else is as good as the day I bought it.
  1936. I am thoroughly satisfied with this shower mirror. Finally a design that is simple but functional. The mirror is very easy to take on and off it's mount, as I remove it after every shower to empty the water from the reservoir. The mirror itself is very clear after filling the reservoir with warm water, and has worked in even the steamiest of showers. Haven't found a real need for the &#34;squeegee&#34; yet - I can see find without it. Installation was easy as well, and the amount of adhesive that was provided was the perfect amount to apply a generous portion to each &#34;groove&#34;. I was originally contemplating one of the mirrors that actually has you connect it to the water supply line, but those are much more expensive and must be placed directly next to the shower head. The only question left is durability - I've had it for a month. Definitely recommend this product.
  1937. The search is over. A wonderful product that I have been looking for for a long time. Works perfectly. I decided to not use the adhesive and instead used one of those shelves you can hang in the shower. Thanks for a great product.
  1938. This mirror works very well. You take it off the wall mount stand and fill it with hot water from the shower then put it back on the stand. The hot water keeps it from fogging. Very easy very simple. My husband's only complaint is that it is a little small.

  1940. Excellent product. Lives up to its billing. I used Command strips to attach it to the shower instead of the included silicone adhesive. If I ever need to remove the mirror bracket just a pull on the strips and it's released and no glue to clean up after.
  1941. 1 year after purchase, this mirror no longer held its weight when full of water. In other words, the mirror is tipped all the way toward the floor and will not stand up on its own, so it is almost useless. I assume that the hinge mechanism wore out.<br /><br />Additionally, before the hinge wore out, I had noticed that it fogged much worse than when I got it new. Now, I fill about 10% with hot water and have to lean down to see my neck in the mirror and shave really fast haha.<br /><br />I was very happy when I got it, but now I am very not happy as it does not work well, the warranty period is up, and I don't want to buy a new $30 mirror every year. Seriously, be careful with this purchase if you don't get it for a good price as it didn't last long for me.

  1951. Exactly as advertised, with subtle points very well thought out by the design/engineering team.<br /><br />Pros:<br />1) Simple - The anti-fog method is simple and reliable. It works every time and requires little intervention to use.<br /><br />2) Squeegee - The included squeegee makes removing water/steam a breeze and even has a dedicated storage clip so you don't lose it.<br /><br />3) Shelf - The unit has a little shelf below the mirror; perfect for a razor or toothbrush.<br /><br />4) Color Options - You can match this mirror with most bathroom schemes.<br /><br />5) Easy & Secure Mounting - This mirror uses foam and silicone adhesive to attach. This means it's pretty much a permanent addition to your shower, but it ain't going anywhere!<br /><br />6) Detachable - This is seriously underrated. The mirror easily slides off of the mounting hardware and shelf, allowing you to easily fill the reservoir with hot water. It also makes cleaning the mirror and mount very easy.<br /><br />Cons:<br />1) Bulky Depth - Obviously, the depth of this mirror is required in order to provide the anti-fog method (hot water reservoir), but it doesn't detract from the fact that it's still a bit bulky. If size is a major concern for you, you may want to check out other options.<br /><br />2) Plastic - The mirror is adjustable to height, but every time I change the height, I pray the plastic doesn't snap; it simply doesn't feel like it's high-quality.<br /><br />3) Mirror - Don't get me wrong, the mirror is entirely functional, however it is easy to tell that it's of lower quality. When I'm in the shower, I noticed subtle &#34;waves&#34; and &#34;curves&#34; in the mirror which very slightly distort your reflection. The upside of the acrylic mirror is that dropping the detachable mirror-portion from time to time has not broken the mirror, but again, this was at those cost of reflection quality. Oh, and the size is also sort of small; you have to stand a little back from the mirror to catch your entire head in its frame. Since I used to put my contacts in AFTER my shower, I had to change things up a little to use it seamlessly.<br /><br />Overall, this mirror greatly exceeds my experience with anti-fog coated mirrors. The hot water reservoir is great and works every time, and has not resulted in any deterioration of this mirror over the course of a year. It seems very well engineered-thought-out, but also seems constrained to cheaper construction in order to provide a better price-point. As of now, it's DEFINITELY worth the $30 it cost me!catch your entire head in its frame. Since I used to put my contacts in AFTER my shower, I had to change things up a little to use it seamlessly.<br /><br />Overall, this mirror greatly exceeds my experience with anti-fog coated mirrors. The hot water reservoir is great and works every time, and has not resulted in any deterioration of this mirror over the course of a year. It seems very well engineered-thought-out, but also seems constrained to cheaper construction in order to provide a better price-point. As of now, it's DEFINITELY worth the $30 it cost me!

  1971. **UPDATE** 7 months in and the mirror is still tightly affixed to the shower tile and still works as well as day one. HIGHLY recommended. ---------------- Shower mirror works as advertised and I'm impressed with ToiletTree as a company. The mirror mounts easily and effectively and, with the included razor shelf and squeegee, the mirror self-contains everything you need. The most important thing, though, is that IT ACTUALLY DOES *NOT* FOG UP and works as advertised!   1982. I've been shaving in the shower for 20 years, and I get a much better shave that way. My beard gets wetter and cuts more easily. I've tried a variety of creams and prefer the following (in no particular order): Cremo, Art of Shaving, Aveda, RS Cream (not gel), and Burts Bees. I splurged on an Art of Shaving razor -- it has a light which makes shower shaving easier.<br /><br />This is the smaller of the two mirrors this company offers. The smaller one works better, since the lights stay bright longer (same # of batteries, smaller # of lights). The larger one seemed to need batteries every 2-3 weeks. The smaller mirror also fills more quickly.<br />.<br />If you already have the larger mirror and are not happy, buy the smaller one --- it will fit on the mount you've already stuck to your wall.<br /><br />If you haven't tried shaving in the shower yet, you really should -- I think you'll be amazed at how much easier it is to get a good shave, and how much better your skin feels.

  1998. I didn't know that this item required the filling of a small tank with hot water in order to keep it from fogging. Then, one has to slide it into a bracket of sorts that one mounts on the wall. The actual mirror, is very dark, and very unclear. The mirror has about 6 or 7 positions that one clicks into place to line up for good viewing of one's face when shaving. This worked for about a year. Then, after this time, the weight of the water in the reservoir in the back of the mirror causes the mirror to constantly fall into the lowest position where one is unable to see one's face in order to shave. If one reduces the amount of water in the tank, the mirror stays put in the position one wants it in, but then the mirror fogs up. This is very, very frustrating and disappointing. It renders the mirror, which as I said, is not that bright or clear to begin with, virtually useless. And, to add insult to injury, the bracket goes on the wall with such strong adhesive, that it appears impossible to remove from the wall, to replace it with a decent shaving mirror. Above was my original review. Soon after submitting it, I was contacted by the company and informed that several improvements had been made in the product (larger surface, and stronger, better holding bracket),and that the company wanted to offer me a replacement with the new version, free of charge. The new mirror was better in that it stayed in the place that I set it at, and it was bit bigger viewing surface. However, the mirror is still made of plastic, and is still dark and a bit distorted...even with the tiny &#34;lights&#34; that surround it...they are totally useless. But the new mirror stayed in the place I set it at, so I made due, and used it. Also, I did appreciate that the company took note of my disappointment, and was kind enough to replace the product. However, after some time( I'm not sure how long, but certainly not long enough Long enough would be never) the mirror is back to falling when the reservoir is full, and I find it infuriating. Also, I've cut myself twice when I jumped as a result of the mirror suddenly dropping without warning. The product, I'm sorry to say, has proved to be totally disappointing and useless in every way.

  2015. I started shaving in the shower about 2 years ago. I started with a mirror that connects to the showerhead. It did Ok. It did leave the water shooting at your face and required regular adjustment. It would also waste water. I the purchased a \\"Fog Free\\" mirror with an LED surrounding it from a store in the mall with high end gadgets. It was held on with suction cups and would regularly fall off. It was never fog free. After it landed in a full tub one time, the light never worked.<br />***This mirror is the best***<br />1. Easy to install<br />2. Adjustable direction if you have people of different heights<br />3. Take 3 seconds to fill and replace from the main tub faucet. 8 to 10 seconds to fill from the shower<br />4. Never fogs<br />5. never falls<br />6. Shelf for the razor<br /><br />****I will have one of these in every shower I ever own/rent***
  2016. I've had this mirror for over a year now and I absolutely love it. It is 100% fog free as long as you fill the reservoir with hot water and that's pretty darn easy to do. After about a year of use in my house with the very hard water that I have it was to the point where I could barely use it to shave anymore and I couldn't get it clean with soap and water so I decided to risk it and try CLR and sure enough it cleaned it so well it looks brand new again!! I was really worried that CLR would be too harsh on it but it didn't mess it up in the slightest so for those of you who were worried about this like I am, don't be!

  2030. Let me say I've used this mirror for OVER 2 YEARS now. And have gone through 2 of them and am now on my 3rd. Clearly I like them so I'll tell you what I do and don't like about them.<br /><br />Positives:<br />+ Definitely FOGLESS, this design is the only way to truly get a fogless mirror in the shower.<br />+ Securely attaches to the wall<br />+ Tilt function<br />+ Price, while $25 isn't exactly a giveaway, nothing else competes at this pricepoint<br /><br />Negatives:<br />- It is all plastic, not a bad negative, but don't expect solid construction and plan on replacing it (see below)<br />- Adhesive is difficult to remove. If you ever need to move, you will need to remove the silicone which is tough to remove and if renting could result in damage fees<br />- The tilt function eventually gets &#34;weak&#34; and requires purchasing a new unit or else the mirror will fall into the most downward facing position when full<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />This is a great mirror as long as you understand the removal process requires some work. A razor blade and some goo-gone will NOT do it. Also wish the construction of the tilt mechanism was more solid construction instead of plastic that wears out in a few months causing the mirror to be stuck in the downward position. All-in-all though, for $25 I don't mind buying a new one about every year. Don't expect this to be one of those products that lasts a lifetime, and if you do remove it, expect a hassle. I give it 4 stars because it truly is fogless, the price is right, but the product needs to be more durable for a 5-star review.<br /><br />Note: keep in mind I have been using this product for years, unlike other reviewers who have been using it for a couple weeks. Sure I would've given it 5-stars then as well, not knowing how it would break and be hard to remove. So I hope this helps give you the full picture!<br /><br />UPDATED REVIEW: SELLER UPDATED THEIR PRODUCT! The product was updated in that the entire back side is now a &#34;sticker&#34; that you peel off and stick to the wall, instead of the silicone adhesive that was previously used. This is good for being easier to remove from the wall, but worse in that the sticker isn't re-usable vs the old style you could just apply more silicone adhesive.ow a &#34;sticker&#34; that you peel off and stick to the wall, instead of the silicone adhesive that was previously used.   2094. I have used this mirror for almost a year now. I purchased it after failed use of \\"fogless\\" mirrors bought at big chain stores that fogged the very minute the water got remotely hot. I read all of the reviews and decided to give it a chance. The mirror does have some flaws, but I feel that it is the best option available and works well. In fact, I just moved and didn't want to pull the mirror down and try to readhesive it to my new shower wall, so I just purchased a new one. I read some reviews again after purchasing it and thougth I should leave one of my own should someone want to read and add to their decision making.<br /><br />First of all, I read some complaints about the adhesive. I like the adhesive option better than suction cups. Though more permanent, I have never had much luck with suction cups in the shower. We had a sprayer held on by suction cups in our old shower and it would fall down every two weeks or so. I also don't want a more permanent option like screws! I never had a problem with the adhesive.<br /><br />Yes, you do have to fill the mirror with water each time you want to use it. I don't think this is a problem and if fact realize that it is the source of the mirror working so well. All I do is run the shower for a minute and then fill the mirror with the water. It works well every time and I can shave right in the shower; something I have grown to love. I now hate shaving out of the shower and can't wait for my new mirror to arrive.<br /><br />The biggest flaw is in fact the hinge. It does fail over time. Luckily for me the spot the mirror would stay at was at a good enough height for me that it did not cause me to tear the mirror off the wall and throw it. I definitely do not see this as a deal breaker because when I have it at the installed height I want it I don't plan on tilting the mirror at all. SO, if/when it fails again I will simply add a screw in the hinge or jerryrig it with something to bypass the hinge and thus keeping the mirror aimed at the right angle.<br /><br />In summary, the price is maybe a few dollars high for the product. I like the plastic construction. I had no problems with the adhesive. The hinge is flawed, but I feel easily fixable and worth dealing with. This is by far, in my opinion, the best option for a fogless mirror in the shower. Thank you for reading!

So that out of the way, this is the best fogless mirror i've used so far. The thing works as advertised unlike many other &#34;fogless mirrors&#34; i've purchased.
  2100. So far, I'm very pleased with this product. I had the Ace fogless mirror for several years prior to purchasing this mirror and always liked the simplistic yet EFFECTIVE way that it stayed fogless from using warm shower water. The Toiletree mirror does this just as well, BUT it is wider which makes it easier to see your whole face, plus it has the little squeegee which may seem gimmicky when reading about it, but it actually works well. It especially is useful for those with hard water that can leave water spots as you'll keep the mirror surface cleaner/unspotted much easier. I tend to squeegee it right before I shave of course, but then also before I get out of the shower after the water is off. This should help preserve the mirror's surface longer which was the main problem with the Ace mirror I used in the past.<br /><br />I wanted to drop the review down by 1 star only because the price is kind of a hit, but I think it may last a long time, so perhaps the price is worth it. After roughly 30+ days, it is. This also holds true given the wall attachment method (silicone adhesive which is easy to use and removeable) versus other mirrors that use suction cups which get brittle and don't hold over time (which also happened with the Ace mirror).
  2101. I use it all the time! I don't shave without i! Thats how good this fogless mirror is! Great product
  2102. Bought this one to replace my first, now a few years old. The older one was a bit clunkier, heavier & the nubs that held the mirror in place had worn down, so the mirror tilted down when full of water. The updated design/manufacture is vastly improved; the mirror is lighter weight overall & the plastic sturdier; the mirror virtual locks at your chosen tilt angle. I liked the first one enough, despite not exactly ideal design, to reorder. This updated design is even better/higher quality - I'm a big fan.

  2153. It's coming up on three and a half years since I purchased this. I installed it in the shower within a day or two of getting it. I've used it literally every single day since. This meets the requirements for a fogless mirror. Very early on, when I first started using it, the image was very distorted, almost to the point that it could take on any funhouse mirror in a deathmatch. However, after a week or two of red-hot water fills from the shower, it seemed to stabilize, and it has had an entirely normal mirror view ever since. When I purchased it, the cost was twenty-nine, ninety-five. Today, the price is twenty-nine, ninety-five. I definitely had spent more than this on the first five or six &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors that eventually failed. I wish I had discovered this back then. It is worth every single cent. Update June 2017: six and a half years now. One problem did crop up a year or two ago - the little 'ratchet' that holds it at whatever angle you set it at had apparently worn down, so when it was full of water, it would not stay in position, instead just tipping until it was all the way down. I emailed the company. They were aware of the problem, and sent a new ratchet mechanism, which you just pressed in place where the old one was. Perfect. No charge for the replacement part. And yeah, it's still stuck on the wall, has never come down in six and a half years. If you shave in the shower, and you don't buy this product.....you're a chump! None of the other mirrors comes close to the quality of this.

  2164. UPDATE: After six weeks, the unit came crashing down in my shower. It turns out I did NOT use the entire tube of silicone adhesive. But, the old silicone adhesive was very easy to pull off with a little work with my fingers. That's a relief! I am going to the store to buy a large tube of silicone to correct this problem.<br /><br />You'll see that this Fog-less Shower Mirror is very popular and with good reason. I shopped for a long time and purchased some very poor shaving mirrors. The one I ended up using was a ten dollar department store suction cup circled mirror. It constantly fogged.<br /><br />The reason this mirror stays fogless is that it simply uses your hot shower water to balance the temperature from behind the mirror to the front of the mirror. As long as you fill up the relatively small reservoir behind the detachable mirror before you shower, it will remain fogless.<br /><br />Assembly had me a bit worried as it truly is permanent. There are no suction cups, but rather two one-inch adhesive squares to initially hold the mirror reservoir/shelf. Then you apply three toothpaste sized strips of silicone adhesive to the back and place it on the wall. It does not matter if your shower wall is tile, slate or fiberglass. It is recommended that you thoroughly clean the surface first and then wipe with rubbing alcohol and wait 24 hours for a solid seal. I suspect if I ever need to pull this off the tiles, it will take some razor blades.<br /><br />The frame is adjustable which is very very handy, but the frame pivot is plastic and very stiff. I am always very careful when trying to adjust the mirror, as it seems like it could break. So far, it's good. The shelf at the bottom of the mirror is very handy for holding razors, but not much else. It would have been nice to have lip of some kind on the shelf so the razor won't fall off. Moving around in a shower spray, I have had it slip off. The provided squeegee is nice to use actually, as a hand towel or sponge will not take the spottiness of water drops off as well as the single swipe of this squeegee. The squeegee slides nicely into the tray for storage.<br /><br />The price for this mirror system is reasonable considering all the products out there that don't work. Read the rest of these reviews and I think you'll find it truly is a better shower/shaving mirror than any of the others offered here at Amazon or elsewhere.e will not take the spottiness of water drops off as well as the single swipe of this squeegee. The squeegee slides nicely into the tray for storage.<br /><br />The price for this mirror system is reasonable considering all the products out there that don't work. Read the rest of these reviews and I think you'll find it truly is a better shower/shaving mirror than any of the others offered here at Amazon or elsewhere.
