The fogless capability is awesome, the squeegee is a great addition, and the tilting mirror is exactly what the doctor ordered. If you have any question about whether this product is going to be the &#34;best option&#34; for you, I'd love to say &#34;definitely, yes!&#34;, but I don't know your needs. I *can* tell you that this mirror is perfect for my needs, good craftsmanship, and I've had ZERO issues so far...so I think you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you don't at least consider/try this mirror.
  2194. Writing this several months after buying/hanging up. I didn't use all the silicone in the tube, but it's hanging fine and doesn't feel like it'll fall any time soon. Absolutely no complaints about how well it works. Fill the back with water, wipe it with the squeegee, and it stays completely fogless throughout even long showers.<br /><br />The one thing I'd hesitate on when buying this is that it's &#34;semi permanent&#34;. I'm sure removing it wouldn't be that bad, but you do stick it to the shower wall with silicon adhesive. This may be a deal breaker for some apartment dwellers.

  2198. I like this shower mirror. I upgraded from a cheap round suction cup mirror and the larger square mirror is great.<br /><br />The mirror is well designed and built well. The mirror is large enough to see your entire face and the mounting system is solid. Having a water reservoir built into the back of the mirror is a great idea. It really helps keep it fog free. It is semi-permanently mounted, so it may not be for all users. You could move it, but you would have to clean up the tape and silicone adhesive and find replacement mounting material at a hardware store.<br /><br />The only reasons I rated it four stars: The distortion of the plastic mirror surface can be a little annoying. The cost is high for all plastic. Yes, the plastic reflective surface makes it lighter, but at this price I would have preferred a more durable material...like real glass.<br /><br />Bottom line: I like it and it works very well.

  2204. Great product with two flaws that I fixed.<br /><br />First I shave wet electric in the shower using Norelco after I lost 10% of my hearing to Panasonic (closer foil shave though).<br /><br />Here are the flaws and fixes:<br /><br />1. Worked great when filled with hot water to stop fogging. When you come back next day you have to physically remove the mirror to fill it again. Fix: 1mm hole drilled into bottom but pay attention if you have the mirror tilted upward, you will have to drill near the rear edge, now water slowly drains out so you will find it dry for the next round.<br /><br />2. Bottom tray is useless, everything rolls off. I like to keep my shaving cream tube on it. Fix: remove mirror, aplly heat gun at 250F for one minute, bend front edge up, voila, no more rolling off.<br /><br />I love everyhting except the logo, toilet(tree) has an insalubrious connotation:)
  2205. Fantastic product!!! As described!!! The mirror is large, well-lit, doesn't fog, and sticks to wall perfectly. Highly recommend. I especially like the squeegee to get rid of any excess water from the mirror. A++++++

  2216. Well, I read all the reviews and wondered how many of them were real reviews from real people. Some of them seemed like hype. But I ordered the product hoping it would at least be better than what I have used in the past, and it is. Here is my no B.S. review. Fogless? I'll rate that 8/10. Only because I have seen it fog once or twice, despite following the directions. If you put the warm water in, like you're supposed to, it does remain fogless for about 10 minutes. After that, it will begin to fog up and you have to pour out the water and start again. But yah, it does a good job of remaining fog free for the most part. Squeegee? I'll rate that 5/10. It is nice to have a squeegee. I've never seen another mirror that had one. So having one is better than not. But it just doesn't work very well. I find I have to use it over and over again to get the drops off of the mirror. And I can't just run it straight down, I have to try different angles, etc. to get all the water off. The mirror itself? I'll rate that 7/10. Only because the view you get out of the mirror is a little bit distorted. It's not too bad. I can still shave just fine and the clarity is great. But it's a little distorted and I hate that when you look in the mirror and get a distorted view. The overall function of the mirror? I'd rate it 8/10. I'd rate it higher if there wasn't so much work involved. I wish they just made a fogless mirror that just sat up there in my shower and required no effort to keep it fogless. Unfortunately, this one requires work. Not that big of a deal. But when you first get in the shower you have to take the mirror off of the wall (which is easy. It just slides off) and then fill up this chamber behind the mirror with warm water from your shower. Then it becomes a little heavy and you have to carefully place it back on the wall without spilling too much water. It is this warm water that sits BEHIND the mirror that is what keeps the mirror from fogging. Then at the end of your shower you have to lift it off and dump the water out. It's not too difficult but it's definitely more work than any other mirror. It would be nice is they just made a mirror that was fog free without all these steps. The mirror does swivel up and down, which I find very nice. I love that feature. It appears to be very well made. Sturdy. The mounting system was great and had very clear installation instructions. Overall, it lives up to MOST of the hype. But it is a little more work than I thought it would be and the mirror doesn't give off a totally accurate view. So if those things were fixed I'd give it a 10/10. Regardless, I agree that this probably is the best one on the market. It does a great job of staying fog free for at least 10 minutes or more. So that in and of itself is amazing. But the mirror has a lot of other cool features that all the others don't have. So until they invent something even better, I'd have to say that this is probably as good as it gets.

  2232. I turn water onto its hottest temperature, fill reservoir, and reduce to milder water temps for my shower. No issues with fogging.<br /><br />Over the previous 15 years, I've had 4-5 mildly differing solutions. All were smaller with suction-cup backing, and none ever lasted more than 2-years. All but one were more expensive; some had lights, all were of lower quality and/or smaller mirror. I don't know how I'll feel in 2-3 years with ToiletTree product, but from my experiences I'm currently a fan.<br /><br />Recommended improvement (learned when one of my former suction-cup mirrors cracked after falling off the wall when suction stopped working): make a hole at the base of the reservoir, allowing water to drain out completely over a 30-minute period. Some benefits: reservoir is only detached once per session, reducing force applied to bracket; water never sits for long in the reservoir; easier for me.

  2267. AWESOME! For those that are a little confused, you fill the compartment behind the mirror with hot water, or the same temperature of water you take your shower in. The compartment is not something that you disconnect. The mirror is one piece and the compartment is behind it. When you are done taking your shower, you simply remove the mirror from it's base (pedestal) and dump the water out. I always forget this part after taking my shower and find myself doing it each time before I take my next shower. I must get into a rhythm with this part, but it does work flawlessly. There is a squeegee that comes with the mirror so that you can wisk the water off the mirror after filling it, since you will have water on the mirror most likely. Once set up there is absolutely no fog and I can see myself clearly while shaving.<br /><br />Kit will come with tape and silicone to mount securely on your shower wall, and will work on glass, plastic, or tiled shower walls.

This is a great product from a great company and I would not only recommend this, but I am hinting of giving it as gifts!!!<br /><br />Update:<br />07/27/2014<br />Well it finally happened. A few days ago the mirror let loose. A little over 1 year from purchase, the bracket things that connects to the wall came loose. The mirror made a tremendous crashing sound, and it found my mirror lying in the bottom of my tub. I do want to make it clear that the mirror did not break, even when falling about 6 feet from where it was mounted on my wall to the tub floor where I found it. The little squeegee thing had come out of it's holding slot. But really, I mean I was surprised it wasn't damaged after that kind of fall and impact.<br /><br />I also want to make it clear that the mirror was still attached to the bracket, even after the fall. The impact shifted the angle of tilt for the mirror, but the mirror and bracket were still intact. I could have re-attached the bracket to the wall, but I accidentally broke the clip post thing on one side, so the mirror will now not click into place. But I caused that problem, until I broke the post I planned to get some silicone and remount the mirror.<br /><br />As I inspected what happened, if looks to me like I didn't apply the silicone exactly how I should have, and that is what caused the bracket to come loose. Originally I tried to apply silicone to some other areas to \\"help\\" the bracket be more secure, and in doing so, I failed to apply the silicone correctly. So I don't fault the company or product for coming loose.<br /><br />I will not be re-purchasing this product however because it did have one major flaw. No light. I see I can get the lighted version of this mirror for a little more and so I am going to upgrade to the lighted version. And I am doing that happily.<br /><br />This mirror was very durable and very effective. Once I put the water in, there was no fog. I love shaving in the shower, and this mirror was excellent for that. I have absolutely 0 buyer's remorse. I have already highly suggested this product to family and friends. This mirror works incredibly well. The image is clean and clear, and it does not fog up. This is an excellent product from an excellent company. I am not even hesitant in purchasing the lighted version.<br /><br />I myself simply can not believe the negative ratings for this product. I have really enjoyed this mirror and would buy it again in a heartbeat if not for the lighted model. If you want a fog free mirror for your shower, I couldn't recommend this one enough. I can't see how you could be disappointed. I wasn't. This mirror was great!
  2277. May, 2013 -- So one of the features of this mirror is that you can set it at a comfortable angle once it is filled with water. Just as many others have said, after about 6 months, the mirror no longer stays on the angle I need, because the teeth which are supposed to hold it in place wear out under the weight of the water. Now it just flops down, facing the floor, useless to me. Don't waster your money on this.<br /><br />June, 2013 -- After posting my review I heard directly from the President of Toilet Tree. He apologized, and said that the defect in the product has been corrected, and sent me a replacement mirror, which works exactly as advertised. I can now recommend this product. It does what it says, and the company was very responsive. Kudos to them for fixing the problem, and for being so consumer-friendly!
  2278. Absolutely fog free, great mounting,excellent clarity. I haven't seen my face this well for a shower shave in over 30 years.I wear glasses, but this mirror compensates for not having them on, incredible!
  2279. I've had this mirror a few weeks now, and man what a difference shaving in the shower can make. Easy, fast, and smooth. Great idea at a great price!
  2280. This fogless shower mirror works perfectly. It is impossible for it to fog up when it is filled with hot water, and will stay fogless the entire time you are in the shower, so in that, it does its job perfectly. There are only 2 reasons that I didn't give this a 5-star review, and they are probably too picky. First, the mirror is kind of distorted. Not really a big deal, honestly. Second, the plastic squeegee handle warps easily, making it pretty worthless. This could be solved by a minor engineering change, but then again, I didn't buy this product for the squeegee. I bought it to use in my shower and to not have it fog up, and it does that perfectly.
  2281. Liked it so much I took it with me on my move! Just adding hot or warm water to the reservoirs keeps it fog free and easy on your eyes.
  2282. this product is excellent I've been using for a few years now and provides a great tool to use to shave in the shower, really works and stays clear
  2283. Arrived quickly and well packaged! My husband loves this mirror as he always shaves in the shower. The only one we have found that truly does not fog.

  2289. I used to have an anti-fog shower mirror that installed between the inlet pipe and shower head and it worked great. The only problem being the inflexibility of the position. I thought then...there must be a better way. Then I moved and installed a great looking anti-fog mirror in my new shower, convinced this must be the \\"better way.\\" But it started falling off the glass about every three or four days. Even worse, when it was a few weeks old it started fogging badly. The only way I could shave with it was to hold my breath. The reflective surface never was really like a mirror... but it was good enough until it started fogging.<br /><br />Then I ran across the ToiletTree shower mirror on Amazon. It has a reservoir that you fill with hot shower water. It WILL NOT FOG, the reflective surface is very near real mirror quality, and the mounting method (a combination of two-sided tape and removable silicone glue) is fantastic. This anti-fog mirror is the BETTER WAY.<br /><br />If you like the comfort and ease of shaving in the shower and you've been disappointed with other so-called anti-fog mirrors...you have to try this one. It's great!
  2290. Works great, just fill it up with warm water and you get a nice fog free mirror to shave with.
  2291. Does exactly what it says it does, when using you just gotta find the right distance between you ad the mirror to avoid that fun house mirror effect, one thing i do not like about the stand tho is when i go to adjust the tilt it seems to need alot of force to get it to move and it makes a loud click and it makes nervous almost everytime i have to adjust it. I am just hoping that it takes some loosening to make that go away, but other then that i love this mirror.
  2292. I'm in love with this mirror. The concept of filling it with your shower water to keep it from fogging is genius, yet follows basic laws of thermodynamics: a smooth surface that is colder than the surrounding warm moist environment will fog, so make it the same temperature as the environment. Though that being said, if you forget and leave the water in the mirror from your last shower, it will get cold and in your next shower it will fog up if you don't replace it with warm water. This is also why they cleverly included the squeegee, which is key since you'll get water all over it while filling it up. And since it is holding up about a cup of water, you will definitely want to make sure you follow the instructions to glue it to your shower wall - suction cups or double-sided tape alone won't hold that. All in all, a very satisfying purchase.
  2293. This mirror is well designed and adequate. It won't fog up. The water accumulation on the surface reduces visibility but not too much.
  2294. Plastic, Yes - China, Yes. Appears to be a good product, works as advertised, good mirror, a little difficult to adjust. A good value.
  2295. I've had this product for almost two years and it has worked like a charm. One of the best purchases I've made. Highly recommended.
  2296. We ended up returning returning this mirror because it was not equipped with a light. The deluxe model turned out to be a better choice with a light.
  2297. It is true. It is fogless. And that in itself is pretty amazing. I love the concept and how it works. But we have now put it in the cabinet, no longer using it, hoping for a replacement or refund.<br />The mirror part is not glass and is totally WARPED (I assume from the hot shower water) after only 2 months of use. It now behaves as a funhouse mirror making shaving impossible. So in the end, it didn't really matter that it was fogless.<br />Would have been MUCH better off buying a cheap fogless mirror and just replacing it periodically.
  2298. GREAT product!! I bought it for my fiance, dad, and brother and they all LOVE it!! I think I used it more than my fiance! So easy to use and adheres well to the shower wall! Thank you ToiletTree Products!

  2301. After having purchased several shaving mirrors in the last few years and loving none of them very well, I think I may have finally found one worthy of a good recommendation. The ToiletTree Fogless Shaving Mirror does not use suction cups which don't \\"suck\\" very well, but instead permanently adheres to the wall using a silicone adhesive (not sure what happens when I need to take it off the shower wall but I am not doing that anytime soon). The secret to the \\"fogless\\" mirror is the fact that you fill the mirror (or the back of the mirror) with warm water so that you don't get condensation on the mirror when you shave. It works great!!<br /><br />My only little nit with this product is that the shelf that fits under the mirror is pretty lame and only holds two small razors and then just barely. They could have designed a bit bigger shelf to hold things. However, this is only a small nit, and doesn't detract from the overall usability of the product.<br /><br />Good value for the money!

  2354. I bought this mirror about 4 months ago, so I am now confident to write a review of it.<br /><br />The GOOD:<br />- It's really fogless. No doubt about it. If you use as directed you can shave and it will remaing fogless for a long time. I take a long time to shower, and it's never fogged up before I'm done.<br />- Good quality of materials<br />- Very good size and easy to install<br /><br />The NOT SO GOOD:<br />- The surface of the mirror (at least mine), is not perfectly flat. So, if I'm looking at it and move my head to the sides, it kind of distorts the image a little bit, kind of what happens with funhouse mirrors. I think the manufacturer might want to look into making sure the material is very flat, so there is no image distortion. If you get closer to the mirror, the distortion is reduced and you will have no problems with it, but it made me dizzy until I got used to it. A fix to this would make this mirror absolutely perfect.<br /><br />Hope this helps!

  2361. This was actually purchased as a gift for a friend because I received one of these for Christmas in 2013 and when he used it at my house, he was very impressed with it. I waited a long time to put it up, because that's what happens at my house. When I finally got around to it, installation was pretty easy, you just have to let it sit overnight while the adhesive cures. Some of the reviews complain about having to fill it with water every time you use it and then remember to empty it, but those two actions combined take less than 10 seconds total. It works exactly like it is supposed to, and doesn't fog up when it has warm water in the reservoir. Some of the reviews also complain about the size, or the distortion of the mirror, but I don't have an issue with the size, and I can only see a tiny amount of distortion all the way at the very edge of the mirrored surface. Why anyone would complain about that, I have no idea. It has not affect on its use whatsoever. I've had this installed for 9 months or so now, and it is still securely attached to the wall and hasn't shown any signs of loosening. I shave about 2-3 times per week, and I have tile walls in my bathroom. Your mileage may vary, depending on use rates and wall material, but I have a hard time believing it would come off regardless, as long as you follow the instructions.

  2377. A true rarity: a product's performance matching (even exceeding) its advertising claims. What a pleasure it is, jumping into the shower and knowing I can see well enough to give myself a decent shave.
  2378. This mirror does indeed stay free of fog, providing a clear, if mildly distorted reflection. The surface isn't completely flat, and thus there's slight fun-house effect one might expect from a warped surface. But the distortion is minor and doesn't really interfere with shaving. The up-down swivel is very stiff, so it's a good thing there aren't two people of different heights that want to use this mirror. I think daily adjustment would probably result in breakage pretty quickly. Mine hasn't broken, but I'm not going to test it. There's also no horizontal (left-right) adjustment, so you can't stick it in the corner unless you want to stand up against the side wall to see yourself. The fog-free mechanism is simple--just fill with warm water and the reflective surface stays warm enough to prevent fog. Dump the water when done.<br />The reflective surface is as clear as glass--it's a good mirror--but it might be some kind of plastic. I'm not certain, and again I don't want to test it for fear of breaking it or scratching it.<br />The adhesive SAYS it's removable, but it appears to be silicon caulk, so don't count on it being easily removable. You're going to mount this one time and one time only. Once it's up, it'll stay up, and removing it will probably destroy the base. In any case, you only have enough mounting adhesive for one try.<br />Overall, this is a good product. Not perfect, but good enough.
  2379. 1. Product arrived quickly and safely.<br />2. Product was packaged nicely.<br />3. The company's owner/manager contacted me via E-mail with some quick guide tips on installing, using, and maintaining the product.<br />4. The director of marketing E-mailed me and mentioned that if I'm not satisfied with the product to contact her immediately.<br /><br />If a company takes all these steps to insure that you have received your product timely, safely, and are completely satisfied with using it, then how can you go wrong?<br /><br />Overall, great product, company, and corporate culture (in the above respects. Keep up the wonderful work everyone!
  2380. Second mirror we purchased. First one did not work at all. This one is great! I have a happy husband!!!
  2381. I bought this mirror for my husband. He really likes it. We have to be careful to empty the water from it each day as I am concerned that having standing water in the cahmber could get gross - so far so good. I also wonder about the day when I will have to take it off the wall - as you need to use the entire tube of provided adhesive to apply it along with the double sided tape.   2392. The concept of this mirror is great. It's much easier for me to shave in the shower and keep the mess off the sink. It does need improving. First thing is, make the mirror bigger. Make it double the size. I hate having to scrunch to see what I'm doing in a mirror this small. The second thing is to make it not distort/warp. When it was new, I don't remember the mirror being distorted. Now, almost the entire mirror is warped. It's like shaving in a fun house mirror, but not very fun.

  2396. Very sturdily sticks to the shower wall with included adhesive. Shelf is handy, although most shaving cream containers are too thick to fit on it and behind the mirror.   2407. Been using this mirror for 14 months now. Great product and true to its word. This shower mirror does not fog when hot water put into it, no matter how long of a shower I take.
